loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Madame Julie is a single parent of two(2) children who walks to nearby towns and villages to buy vegetables and other foodstuffs to sell at the market. She requires a loan of $650 to expand her business and look after her children. She is familiar with Kraban Support Foundation's TEACH Lending program. She is also good at keeping records.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy intends to buy 1 tonne of clay, ochre and employee 7 more workers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary L. is newly married to a civil servant. She operates a mini-mart to supplement her husband's income. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been briefed by the TEACH Lending Program. She needs a loan of $875 to expand her mini-mart.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a hard-working woman who wishes to expand her business. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program and has the  entrepreneurial skills to manage her business. She needs a loan of $750 to expand her business by buying more cloths and opening more branches in the near-by towns and villages.By this, she hopes to employ more hands to help her. She will therefore create jobs fot the unemployed youth in her community.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Korkor

texts.en: Madame Korkor is a 72-year-old woman who has been left to fend for herself by her family. She therefore sells clothes to cater for her basic needs. She would like a loan of $650 to expand her business. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program and simple accounting methodologies because she is a client of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Dede

texts.en: Dede is a school dropout. She left school because her parents could not afford to pay her fees in addition to those of seven other siblings. She now sells fish on a wooden board. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She knows about the TEACH Lending program and has knowledge of record-keeping. She needs a loan of $675 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has been through the TEACH Lending program. She understands simple book-keeping techniques and needs a loan of $700 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mr. G. has a great deal of experience in this line of work, as he has done it for over 30 years. His intention is to buy modern, high-tech equipment.

"I have been trying for a while to get up-to-date with the most modern equipment, but I have not succeeded. Sometimes I have to tell my customers that I don't have the necessary equipment to be able to fix their vehicle, which makes a bad impression and they won't recommend me. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to buy the equipment that I need."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor G. tiene una amplia experiencia en este oficio mas de 30 años lo respaldan su intencion es comprar equipo moderno y con alta tecnología. "Llevo tiempo tratando de ponerme al dia con los equipos mas modernos pero no lo he logrado, hay ocasiones que tengo que decirles a mis clientes que no cuento con el equipo indispensable para poder arreglar su vehiculo y eso me produce una perdida sobre todo porque se mal interpreta y ya no me recomiendan. Solicito $1,200.00 dlls para comprar el equipo que necesito.

loans.use: To buy high-tech equipment. / Comprar equipo con alta tecnología.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a spinner for her wool spinning and weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used toys in bulk for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a place for her food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wool stocks and a spinning machine for her weaving business

loans.name: Fiordaliza

texts.en:
Fiordaliza A. E. lives with her husband, Fabio Cruz, and their three children in a house attached to the back of her store. She sells fresh fruit and vegetables that she has brought in from larger outdoor markets outside of her town. Along with produce, Fiordaliza sells beverages, canned food and even some cleaning supplies such as soap and detergent. She has requested this new loan to purchase basic cooking ingredients and essential food staples from salt and sugar to rice and beans as well as replenish her inventory.

A large portion of her sales come from miniature orders such as one green pepper, a cookie, four slices of bread or a few grams of salt. Selling staples consumed in larger quantities such as rice and beans will increase her profit and round out her inventory so she can cater to individual purchases as well as family-sized orders.

NOTE: As with most Esperanza loan recipients, Fiordaliza is a member of a solidarity group, which receives and pays back equal shares of one loan. This $750 loan will benefit four other entrepreneurs and their businesses along with Fiordaliza’s. They formed their "Banco de Esperanza" (Bank of Hope), went through business training and will repay their loan together. If one person is struggling to pay on time in full, their group will help to make up the difference.

loans.use: Replenish inventory and pay expenses

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is married with only one child left as her other four died when they were young. Her husband died 7 months ago, therefore she has to work. With the initial capital from selling her TV, she uses a small table in front of her house to sell some snacks and candies. After joining MBK as a member, she is now able to increase her income. She hopes to get a bigger loan to buy more snacks and candies.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Yani

texts.en: Yani is 27 years old and is married with two children ages 8 and 7. She makes fried beans and chips and then sells them through several small shops nearby, or sells them directly to some factories near her village. She sells 5kg of fried beans for $7.50 and 5kg of chips for $13.00.  Her husband, Mulyadi, works as a household goods seller. She needs more working capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Ipat

texts.en: Ipat is a 35 year old mother of four children. The eldest works in a factory nearby and he often gives her some money. She and her husband, Mamet, have two businesses which are making doormats out of fabric remnants, and selling household goods like dishes, pans and woks on credit. She sells her products in her village and collects the payments every week. She wants to get this loan to expand her businesses.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is divorced and has two children. An elementary school teacher by profession, she was forced to find a better source of income after her husband left her and the children. Today she runs a little kiosk selling children’s stockings and socks. She has been in this business for 8 years. Svitlana is a hard-worker, and puts in many long hours every week. The market where Svitlana has her kiosk operates with no days off. She works more than other vendors, but it pays off for her. Svitlana’s income is higher in comparison with entrepreneurs at other locations. Currently, she has about $1,000 of working capital and her monthly gross revenue amounts to around $400. She has repaid all of her past loans with “Nadiya Ukraine” without any defaults. Svitlana is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory and expand her trade. She is planning to purchase a supply of nylon and cotton stockings and various brands of short and high top socks for the warmer spring season. Svitlana believes that a good selection of super comfortable socks and stockings will find their way to her customers and will help her continue to expand her business and income.

Світлана - розлучена, в неї двоє дітей. За фахом вона – вчителька початкових класів. Після того, як чоловік покинув її, Світлана була змушена шукати можливостей заробляти на життя та забезпечувати власну родинку. Зараз в неї є власний кіоск з продажу дитячих носків та колгот. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 8 років. Світлана – дуже працьовита, вона щотижня багато працює. Ринок, на якому працює Світлана, працює без вихідних. Вона більше часу присвячує роботі, ніж інші підприємці, і це забезпечує її успіх. Прибутки Світлани – значно вищі у порівнянні з іншими підприємцями. Зараз в неї приблизно 1000 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісячні доходи складають приблизно 400 доларів. Світлана сплатила усі попередні позики, які отримала в „Надії України” без жодних прострочень. Світлана просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів та розширити торгівлю. Вона планує закупити більше нейлонових та бавовняних колгот різних виробників, а також легких носків для теплого весняного сезону. Світлана вважає, що гарний вибір зручних носків та колгот обов’язково користуватиметься попитом серед покупців, а це, в свою чергу, допоможе їй й надалі розширювати торгівлю та збільшувати прибутки.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. After graduating from the college of commerce, she worked for a time as a market vendor. She was the only breadwinner in the family and wasn’t able to earn much income. Financial problems brought out her tenacity and innovation, however, and she decided to start her own small business. Today she has a small kiosk selling casual and dressy outerwear for women in one of the local markets. Irina is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She has had a great history with “Nadiya Ukraine” having repaid each of the 12 loans she has received. Irina would like to get a loan for $1,200 to open a new vending facility and re-supply her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing items and will significantly expand her trade with a second location. Irina believes that having an assortment of women’s outerwear that is both practical and fashionable will increase her sales and offer both warmth and style suitable to any taste and weather.

Ірина – одружена. Після закінчення технікуму торгівлі вона певний час працювала продавцем на ринку. Вона одна заробляла на життя, але грошей усе одно не вистачало. Саме фінансові проблеми виявили витривалість та творчі здібності Ірини й вона вирішила почати власний бізнес. Зараз в неї є маленький кіоск з продажу повсякденного та ошатного верхнього жіночого одягу на одному з місцевих ринків. Ірина – дуже наполеглива й працьовита. Вона багато працює задля того, щоб її бізнес був прибутковим. Ірина дуже любить спілкуватися з покупцями, завжди присвячує їм багато часу. В неї чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”, вона сплатила усі 12 позик, які отримала в організації. Ірина хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб відкрити нову торгову точку та закупити необхідний товар. Вона планує закупити різноманітний одяг та значно розширити торгівлю завдяки другому кіоску. Ірина вважає, що широкий асортимент практичних та модних жіночих курток, пальт та светрів збільшить обсяги продажів, а багатьох покупців забезпечить теплим одягом за будь-яких погодних умов.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and lives in the town of Pavlograd. After finishing medical school, she wasn’t able to find a good job in her field of training so she decided to become self-employed and start her own business selling women’s outerwear in the local market. Irina received her first loan from “Nadiya Ukraine” in June of 2006. She understands the value of having readily available lending resources to help her business grow and succeed. Irina is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her turnover capital. She is planning to purchase women’s seasonal clothing in bulk to widen her assortment of inventory for spring and summer. A variety of good quality, durable clothes will help boost Irina’s sales and generate additional profit. Eventually, Irina is planning to invest additional income into the expansion of her business and would like to open a little vending store in downtown Pavlograd.

Ірина – одружена, живе в містечку Павлоград. Після медичного училища не могла знайти гідну роботу за спеціальністю. Отже, вирішила почати власний бізнес та почала торгувати жіночим верхнім одягом на місцевому ринку. Ірина отримала першу позику від „Надії України” ще в червні 2006 року. Вона розуміє, наскільки важливими є доступні кредитні послуги, які сприяли успішному зростанню її бізнесу. Ірина просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити робочий капітал. Вона планує закупити оптом сезонний жіночий одяг для того, щоб розширити асортимент товарів напередодні весняного/літнього періоду. Розмаїття якісного одягу сприятиме збільшенню обсягів продажу, що, в свою чергу, допоможе отримати додатковий прибуток. Ірина планує вкласти отримані прибутки в розширення власного бізнесу – вона хоче відкрити невеличку крамничку в центрі м. Павлоград .

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
After graduating from medical school, Tatyana worked for a while as a nurse. She had always dreamed of being self-employed, however, so she took a risk and started her own small business selling women’s sports and casual outerwear in one of the local markets. Her business has done well. An attractive selection of top-rate, quality clothing at exceptional prices has helped her develop loyal clientele. She has demonstrated responsibility and integrity in working with “Nadiya Ukraine”, repaying every loan she has received with no defaults. Tatyana is requesting a loan for $1,200 that will allow her to increase her inventory of stylish trench-coats, light-weight fleece jackets, rainwear, parkas and other coats which she can get at wholesales prices. Offering a nice assortment of slimmed down and styled up outerwear at the lowest prices will attract many women in need of good clothing and will boost Tatyana’s sales.

Після медичного училища Тетяна певний час працювала медсестрою. Вона завжди хотіла працювати на себе. Отже, вирішила ризикнути та почати власний бізнесу з продажу спортивного та повсякденного жіночого одягу на одному з місцевих ринків. Бізнес Тетяни процвітає. Широкий вибір високоякісного одягу за помірними цінами допомогли Тетяні знайти відданих клієнтів. Тетяна виявила відповідальність та порядність в роботі з „Надією України”, сплативши усі позики без жодних прострочень. Тетяна просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент стильних пальт, плащів, легких курток та парок за оптовими цінами. Широкий асортимент стильного верхнього одягу легкого покрою за низькими цінами привабить багато жінок-покупців та сприятиме збільшенню обсягів продажу Тетяни.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: With close to 20% of the Moldovan population working abroad in different countries life can be very difficult for many families.  Galina C. is 66 years old and lives by herself in the small village of Pruteni, close to the Romanian border, while her husband works in Russia for most of the year.  Remittance from her husband has helped pay for a part of their lives in the village but times have been tough, her son is pursuing his dreams of studying at the national sports school to become a football (soccer) player and she sends him whatever spare money she earns at the local market. Galina, sells brinza at the local market in order to help her son with expenses in the capitol, Chisinau. Brinza is Moldova’s national cheese, a type of sheep cheese which is eaten by every Moldovan, she has decided to start selling more of her product in the local market and at the regional center 45 min away.  She would like a loan to purchase additional livestock, some sheep, to start producing more brinza.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to raise and use the milk to produce Brinza

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: A year ago Raisa C. was proud to undertake one of the biggest challenges of her life.  She decided to use $1000 from her families savings (the average salary for a Moldovan is around $1200-1800 a year in a city but in a village is as little as $600-1000) to purchase the old school building and its land to convert into a grocery store/bar.  The grocery store has been doing well due to its great location in the village next to the casa de cultura (house of culture) though the bar is not as successful as she had hoped. The part of the old school where the bar is located is in need of some repairs and modification in order for Raisa to utilize to its fullest potential.  The bar is in an old class room, adjacent to the store, but a lot of the windows are broken and the patrons don't use the bar as much because it is extremely cold.  Most of the bars in villages only offer beer in bottles and vodka, but Raisa thought it was necessary to be different and hers is the only bar in the village to offer beer on tap which is cheaper.  She is a young, vibrant entrepreneur at 35 years old with three children, two boys 12 and 2 years old and one girl who is 5 years old.  She would like to take a loan to purchase materials and make the bar a desirable location for all.

loans.use: To purchase material to make repairs on her grocery store/bar.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: This will be Olga P.'s second loan from Microinvest.  Her first loan was for $300 to purchase seeds and material for her land.  She harvested last year's crop which consisted of corn, potatoes and sunflowers to sell the seeds and to make into oil and cabbage which all generated enough profit for her to pay off her loan.   She was so proud of her success from her first loan and how well she prospered after taking a small loan that she is eager to take out a larger loan to buy some piglets, to raise and sell at the local market. She is 45 years old, with four children, two girls, 2 and 16 years old and two boys 7 and 20 years old.  The picture is of Olga holding up the contract to start the process of obtaining a loan through Microinvest.

loans.use: To purchase some piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys intends to buy 200 bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace intends to buy 100 bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary intends to buy 3 sacks of potatoes, 1 box of tomatoes and 1 sack of kales and spinach

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice intends to buy clay, ochre and employee 5 more workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy 50 more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty and hair products for her hair salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Monica intends to purchase 9 bags of maize and 4 bags of beans

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Madame Florence is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a loan of $700 to expand her business. She has the requisite record-keeping skills and has been taught the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia operates a food vendor joint popularly called "chop bar" in Ghana. She needs a loan of $750 to be able to provide proper services to her customers by ensuring food safety and security. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been taken through the TEACH Lending program. She also keeps very good records of her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her weaving crafts business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Sister Joyce displays her items on a wooden table in front of her house. She requires a loan of $650 to rent a shop in the local market and buy more inventory for her shop. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of transactions.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hairdressing equipment for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy snacks ingredients for her snack making business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a client of Kraban Support Foundation who knows about the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $750 to expand her business.

She will be able to repay the loan because her record-keeping skills are very good.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en: Germaine provides services such as renting chairs and tables within the community. She lost her husband in 1984, and has 9 children to care for. Germaine felt hopeless for a year and then began her first business in 1985. She used to sell sacs of manioc and plantain bananas until 2000 when she opened a general shop.  She diversified her activities by adding services such as renting chairs and tables, and selling beverages. Germaine is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase 200 chairs and 80 tables in order to meet the demands within the community and make her business more profitable and sustainable. She believes that a prosperous business will help her to support the family and increase savings. Germaine is a hard working woman who has raised her children and paid for their schooling through her business. Currently, her business capital is $500.

loans.use: to add 200 chairs and 80 tables for rental services

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her beading and weaving business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vic moves from door-to-door and house-to-house selling vegetables. The vegetables are mostly from her husband's farm. She does this to supplement the family income. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been educated in the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $650 buy more vegetables from other farmers in and around her locality for onward sale at the market.

loans.use: Expansion of business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with 2 children. She is also supporting the schooling for 6 of her relatives. Josephine started her business in 1976 with $100. She began by selling 10 crates of drinks. During the 90s, her business declined due to the bad political and economic situation in the country. Her business began to attract clients again in 2003. Since she has signed a loan contract with Hope, a Microfinance Organization in DRCongo, Germaine has been a very dynamic person and has repaid every loan she has received. With this new request for $600, Josephine is planning to purchase 50 more chairs and 2 electric serving dishes. Her plans to provide catering services within the community which will have a positive impact on her community by employing three people from her neighborhood. Josephine's business strategies include being friendly with clients, never running out of stock, and informing clients about any change in her business. Her current business capital is $1200, and she commits to saving small amounts each day.

loans.use: to purchase 50 more chairs and 2 electric serving dishes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Aunty Cici has been selling cloth for the past 25 years. She is a widow and has her eldest daughter in the university. She also looks after three other children who are all in school. She does this through the profit she makes by selling cloth. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has gone through the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $700 to expand her business so she can use the profit to look after her children.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: José

texts.en: José began his business in 1983 with a business capital of $50. He has been selling beauty body lotion, small and medium sized radios, padlocks, shoe polish, batteries, etc. He’s had much experience in his business. The 1990s were very tough for José because of the political and economic instability in the DRCongo, which caused the collapse of many companies and businesses.  José started to demonstrate his talents in 2000 by using various methods of developing his business. He keeps trustworthy, permanent relationships with his suppliers in order to gain discounts through bulk buying and update market prices according to his suppliers.  José makes sure his his clients understand each time he must change the prices for things to keep good customer relations. He also tries to save a little each day. Before joining a loan group, José had $400 in business capital. Currently, he has $850. José is requesting a loan of $500. He intends to diversify his business by adding fresh food and beverages which are in high demand in the community. José is married and a father of two children.

loans.use: To increase his business by adding beverages and fresh foods

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Sister Lydia is a trader who buys foodstuffs from farmers in the rural areas and transports them to the urban markets. She needs a loan of $850 to expand her business. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is also familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She will be able to manage the loan because she keeps her records very well.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy operates a business which offers beverages, and women and children’s clothing. She began her business in 1986. The business prospered until 1991 when she went through a hard time during the 90s due to the political and economic instability in the DRCongo. Lucy learned about Hope’s microfinance program through a friend and decided to sign a loan contract. Today, Lucy is on her way to stabilizing her business. She requests a loan of $500, which she will use to buy her merchandise in bulk order to minimize purchase prices.  She also plans to diversify her business by adding men’s clothing so that she can increase her earnings and meet the high demand from the community. Right now,Lucy has $300 in business capital. She is married and has six children.

loans.use: To expand her business by diversifying the brands and types of items she sells

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy's husband drove her away, together with her four children, when he discovered that she was using contraceptives in order to prevent another pregnancy; her last child was just 13 months old. She is currently selling cookware to earn money for her children. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. Kraban Support Foundation has taught her how to keep good records of her business. She needs a loan of $700 to expand her business so she can use the profit to take care of her children.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane has been supplying schools and small organizations with printing services. She has been in this business since 1997. Because of the quality of her work, Viviane has signed partnerships with several schools and organizations within the community. She requests a loan of $500 to enable her to buy printing materials in bulk order which will minimize the cost of production. Viviane is married and has 6 children. Her business’s impact on the community is a positive one. Today, Viviane employs 3 people and supports the basic expenses of her household. Her future plans include expanding the business and offering employment to more people in the community.

loans.use: To buy printing materials in bulk in order to reduce purchase costs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the renovation of her premises in order to exhibit her final products. She'll also buy wood with which to craft furniture.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will invest the new capital in the expansion of his workshop, which will give him the improved working conditions with which to improve the quality of his products.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the capital in the purchase of materials (cement, sand, etc.) in order to increase her production and cover her  clients' orders.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Elwar

texts.en:
Elwar runs a business where he sells purified drinking water. He has been working at this business for about 3 years. He runs the business with the help of his wife who tends to their store. Elwar also runs a laundry service from his home. He owns a couple of machines that he rents out to members of the community.

Elwar will invest the loan in purchasing more bottles for the water. He rents these large bottles out to his clients who trade them in for full bottles when they run out. Elwar sends the empty bottles to be filled by a local water company, but he must buy the bottles in order to work with them. The business is particularly important in these communities because water services do not exist.

Elwar is from Esmeraldas, a rural town in Ecuador. He is 41 years old and has 3 kids that are in highschool. His wife is Colombian and works closely with him. They are a very hard working family and they are optimistic about the future. Elwar’s most important goal is to have his kids graduate from highschool and then college.

loans.use: Buy more water bottles to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has been working as a seamstress for about 8 years. She makes all types of clothing to display from her store, as well as custom jobs for certain customers. Elizabeth’s daughter helps her run the store, which has generated enough profit to purchase three sewing machines. She learned the trade from her mother and improved her skills with a course she took part of. She needs the loan because she wants to invest in cloth, threads and other materials. Elizabeth is 42 years old and has 3 children. She is a single mother who lives in a very humble home made out of wood. She hopes that this loan will help her business grow so she may continue to educate her kids.

loans.use: Invest in cloth, threads and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peshut intends to buy three steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily intends to buy 2 hair-dryers and 3 blow-dryers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Karisia intends to purchase one more steer and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina O., who is a 43 years old and married with four (4) children, lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Tina is a dedicated client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of plywood. She wishes to use her loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more plywood for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane intends to purchase a pig

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elishipah intends to purchase a pig

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Mrs. Bose E. is 36 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with four (4) children. Bose specializes in the sales of cooked food and provides catering services to the community. According to her, if she receives the loan, it will improve business tremendously.

loans.use: To buy more more food ingredients and catering items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy half bag for each cereals amounting to 9 bags of cereal food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace intends to purchase two more piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Virginia Wathika intends to buy a dairy Friesian calf

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina A. is 42 years old and married with eight (8) children. She operates her restaurant and catering business in the ancient city of Benin City in Nigeria. She is a reliable client of LAPO who started her business in the year 1983. The loan will enable her to improve on her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and catering items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther Magiri intends to purchase five bags of cereals

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: "I am happy to be an LAPO member," says Mrs. Fatima M.. She is 35 years old and married with four (4) children. She has been an LAPO client for over 6 years. She lives in Benin City. She will use the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah Wanjiru Mbau intends to purchase one pig and also pay school fees for her child in secondary school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Priscillah Wairimu Ngugi intends to buy four piglets

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. has two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells materials for tailoring. She will use the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en: Valentino R. is from the remote village of Pruteni, located on the Romanain border with Moldova. She is 43 years old, married and has a son who is about to get married. She wakes up every morning to work on her family farm. Her main source of income is producing and selling milk at the local market.  The cow in the picture, with Valentino's husband, is old and has not been producing as much milk as it once did.  Valentino would like a loan to purchase an additional two cows, one for milk and the other to raise to sell for meat.  Along with her one cow now she has 40 chickens and ducks, 2 pigs, 1 hectare of corn, 1 hectare of sunflowers and an another ½ hectare of various crops including grapevines to produce their own house wine.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows to raise for milk and meat in the future.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth Asemota is 50 years old and happily married with seven children. She specializes in the making of local food (Agidi) for the community. She is eager to receive the loan to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more dried maize for production

loans.name: Aigbe

texts.en: A 46-year-old woman, Mrs. Aigbe A. has five children. She specializes in the sale of ice cream for the public. She is willing and hoping for the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mrs. Beatrice O. is 48 years old. She is a market trader who specializes in the sale of drinks and ice cream for the community. She is married with five children. She said that the loan would help her boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria O. is a 48-year-old woman. She is happily married and blessed with six children. She testifies that the LAPO has lifted her up from the grip of poverty. She will use the loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of kerosene

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Mrs. Celestina N. is 29 years old. She has two years of experience. She sells biscuits and bags of water to the community. She is determined to expand her business with the loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more bags of pure water and cartons of biscuits

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Mrs. Becky O. is 38 years old woman. Who is a dynamnic client of LAPO. She has proved her worth of experience in the line of business. She needs the money ($500) to kepp her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallon of oil

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing I. is 34 years old and married with five (5) children. She gained business experience working with her mother, and she started her own business in 2001. She will use the loan to help her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been taken through the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to do proper book-keeping.

She requires a loan of $750 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I. is 52 years old woman who leanrt her trade business for the past 6 yuears. She is happily married with three (3) children. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for processing

loans.name: Edosomwan

texts.en: Mrs. Edosomwan O. is a 35-year-old woman with three (3) children who lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks on wholesale to the public. She will use the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth O. a 45 years old woamn, she is from a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells firewood to people in her environment, married with six (6) children. She needs the above loan to exapnd her business

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sales

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 56-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned her business for 5 years before she started her business in the year 2000. According to her, the amount of $800 will boost her business if it comes to her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks for sale

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Aunty Gifty is the leader of one of the local women's groups in the community. Her aim is to train girls who have dropped out of school. At the moment, her shop can only accommodate four people. She needs a loan of $900 to expand her shop and acquire more sewing machines. This will help her train more girls. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been taught the TEACH Lending program. She also has the necessary record-keeping skills.

loans.use: Acquiring more sewing machines

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Hairdressing in Ghana is mostly considered as a vocation for illiterates and drop-outs. Edith has been able to prove many critics wrong. This is because she has just completed the tertiary level. This has made her a role model for a lot of girls in her community. To continue to be that role model, she will have to expand her business so as to put to use the knowledge she acquired from school and help the up-and-coming ones. She requires a loan of $750 to help her achieve her dream. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with its TEACH Lending program

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a 19-year-old girl who just completed secondary school. Her parents couldn't afford to put her through university. She therefore decided to go into a business venture. Her parents supported her with start-up capital and she has managed the business ever since on her own.

She needs a loan of $750 to expand the business since her parents who helped her from the begining are no more. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and understands the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Sister Patience is a mother of two. She operates a mini-mart to supplement the family income. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She has also been taught how to keep proper accounts of her business. She needs a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of her business transactions. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Desislava

texts.en: Desislava P. is 34 years old and lives in Ihtiman, Sofia district. She is divorced and has a 7 year old boy. She started her business in the middle of 2003 when she has lost her job. She founded a small confectionary workshop in her grandmother’s house. During the first six months the business was going well but later because of the competition in the region Desislava has to quit this kind of business. In the summer of 2006 she started business again and opened a gift shop on the main street of Ihtiman. This shop has benn open for four months.  Now Desislava P. needs a $1200 loan for working capital – for new variety of gifts that she offers in her shop.

loans.use: For working capital – for new variety of gifts for her shop

loans.name: Tzvetanka

texts.en: Tzvetanka J. is 33 years old. She is single and lives with her large family. She has 8 brothers and sisters. After returning home from Germany in the autumn of 2005 she started her own business. Capital for this business she earned in Germany where she worked in a packing factory for three years. Then she opened a clothing shop in the town centre of Ihtiman, Sofia district. This shop has been open for a year and a half and is already one of the most visited trading places in this small town. A month ago Tzvetanka suffered a great loss. A gang of local teenagers broke the shop window and took a large quantity of goods, so now Tzvetanka J. needs to put protecting bars on her shop’s windows. The loan amount is $ 1200.

loans.use: To put protecting bars on her shop’s windows

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation has Cecilia as one of its clients. She has been taken through the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $750 to inject into her business. She knows how to keep records of her businesses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is in need of a $700 loan to expand her business to include a restaurant. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She knows about the TEACH Lending program and can use record-keeping techniques effectively.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en: Sister Maggie (as she is popularly called) deals in plastic household items. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and requires a loan of $675 to expand her business. She knows about the TEACH Lending program and has practical experience in record-keeping.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: H. H. is 38 years old. He is married and has two kids – an elder son and a younger daughter. H. has had his own agricultural business for five years. Before that he was in Germany for six years where he had several jobs. Now H. tills 30 hectares of land on which he grows Lucerne, savory, balm and other herbs. H. H. needs a $1200 loan for seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: For seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en: Nikola S. is an educated construction engineer. His specialty is bridge constriction. For more then 15 years he has worked in Siberia, Russia. After retiring he decided to start an agricultural business because he has 63 hectares of his own land. Now he grows cherry and plum orchards and 30 hectares of special brand mini corn that is being exported. This loan of $ 1200 is going to be used for this special brand corn seedlings.

loans.use: For special brand corn seedlings

loans.name: Sali

texts.en: Sali A. is 38 years old and lives in the village of Sinia voda (Blue water), near Razgrad. He is married and has two sons. Razgrad region has a very high level of unemployment and so Sali started own business. Four years ago he opens a saloon in his native village but soon he has to close it because of the poverty of village people. Later he decided to start an agricultural business. He has 8 hectares of land and rents 22 more hectares and  grows vegetables, strawberries and raspberries. Now he needs some financial help to buy plastic covers for his greenhouses. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To buy plastic covers for his greenhouses

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a seamstress who is very good at her vocation. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She understands the TEACH Lending program and is comfortable using book-keeping skills to run her business. She needs a loan of $750 to expand her business and employ more hands to help her.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mama Comfort is a businesswoman who carries her wares on her head and goes from house to house. She would like to build a shop and buy more products. That is why she needs a loan of $650. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is also abreast of the TEACH Lending program. She has been taught how to keep her records properly.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a widow with two grown daughters. She has a small business selling clothing in one of the busiest city markets in Zaporozhye. She has been in this business for 8 years. Presently, Olga has about $800-1,000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $200-300. Olga is a focused, hard-worker. Her husband recently died of cancer so Olga was forced to work long hours to provide for her younger daughter who lives with her. Her integrity and good reputation make her a pleasant person to work with. She has received and repaid all loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. Olga is requesting a loan for $850 to re-stock her inventory before the spring and summer seasons. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing such as terry-cloth bathrobes, shoes, and men’s and women’s sweaters that always sell well in the spring. Olga believes that hard work in combination with financial assistance will help to sustain and expand her business and continue to provide for her needs.

Ольга – вдова, в неї дві дорослі дочки. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу одягу на одному з найбільших ринків м. Запоріжжя. Її бізнес існує вже 8 років. Зараз в Ольги приблизно 800-1000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає 200-300 доларів. Ольга – дуже цілеспрямована та працьовита. Її чоловік зовсім нещодавно помер від раку. Отже, Ольга була змушена наполегливо працювати для того, щоб забезпечити свою молодшу доньку, яка живе з нею. Ольга – порядна, в неї добра репутація, через що з неї дуже приємно працювати. Вона сплатила усі позики від „Надії України” без жодного прострочення. Ольга просить про позику в 850 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів напередодні весняного та літнього періоду. Вона планує закупити різноманітні товари, а саме, банні халати, взуття, чоловічі та жіночі светри, які завжди користуються попитом навесні. Ольга вважає, що наполеглива праця у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможе їй поступово розширити бізнес та забезпечити усі нагальні потреби її родини.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two children. She has much rich experience working as a bookkeeper, a quality check manager, and as a market vendor. Today she runs a business selling headwear for men and men’s underwear. She has been in this business for 6 years. Ludmila recently opened a new vending facility in one of the local markets. Her 18-year-old son is actively helping her with sales, which helps him earn enough to pay for his college fees. Loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have assisted in the growth of Ludmila’s business. Presently, she has about $1,500 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $200-300. Ludmila is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy inventory for the new vending kiosk. She is planning to purchase good quality men’s underwear at wholesale prices for further retail sale. Ludmila believes that offering a variety of clothing items will help her retain existing clients, find new ones and provide superior service in a competitive marketplace. Maintaining a good balance between price, quality and availability of products will promote further stable expansion of her trade and ensure better living standards for her family.

Людмила – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона певний час працювала бухгалтером, контролером якості та продавцем на ринку. Зараз в неї бізнес з продажу головних уборів та білизни для чоловіків. Людмила займається цим бізнесом вже шість років. Нещодавно Людмила відкрила нову торгову точку на одному з місцевих ринків. Її 18-річний син активно допомагає їй в торгівлі, таким чином заробляє собі на навчання. Позики від „Надії України” сприяли росту бізнесу Людмили. Зараз в неї приблизно 1500 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає 200-300 доларів. Людмила просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб придбати товар для нового торгового кіоску. Вона планує закупити якісну чоловічу білизну за оптовими цінами для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Людмила вважає, що широкий асортимент одягу допоможе їй зберегти постійних клієнтів, знайти нових та забезпечити першокласне обслуговування покупців у порівнянні з її конкурентами. Розумний баланс ціни, якості та різноманітного одягу сприятиме подальшому стабільному зростанню її торгівлі та забезпечить кращий рівень життя для усієї родини.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her new vending facility

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is married with two daughters. She runs a small store selling groceries. The store is located on the first floor of a big apartment building which provides easy access for her clientele. She has been in this business for 7 years and has built up about $1,000 of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to $400-500. Antonina is very cheery and optimistic. Her little grocery store faces high competition as there are many supermarkets in the neighborhood. However, her customer-friendly service and the individual attention she can give help her keep loyal customers. Her responsibility and perseverence have helped Antonina repay all loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Antonina is requesting a loan of $1,200 for a couple of purposes. She is going to do some remodeling work inside her vending facility and she’d like to increase the assortment of food products she has available. Antonina is planning to use the generated income to help her younger daughter launch her own business venture after she graduates from college this year. This loan will help Antonina expand her business, having a positive impact on her trade profitability, and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

Антоніна – одружена, в неї двоє дочок. Вона – власниця невеличкої крамниці з продажу харчів. Крамничка розташована на першому поверсі великого багатоповерхового будинку, через що в Антоніни завжди багато клієнтів. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 7 років, сума її загального робочого капіталу складає приблизно 1000 доларів. Щомісячний прибуток становить приблизно 400-500 доларів. Антоніна – дуже життєрадісна та оптимістична. Їй доводиться стикатися з жорсткою конкуренцією, тому що в цьому районі знаходяться багато великих супермаркетів. Однак, привітне обслуговування та індивідуальний підхід до кожного покупця допомагають Антоніні зберегти відданих клієнтів. Її відповідальність та наполегливість допомогли їй сплатити усі позики, які вона отримала від „Надії України”. Антоніна просить про позику в 1200 доларів через декілька причин. По-перше, вона планує зробити ремонт в крамниці та збільшити асортимент продовольчих товарів. Використати отриманий прибуток Антоніна хоче для того, щоб допомогти своїй молодшій донці почати власний бізнес після того, як вона закінчить навчання в університеті. Ця позика допоможе Антоніні розширити її бізнес, значно збільшить торгівельну прибутковість та допоможе й надалі покращувати економічне та соціальне становище її родини.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two sons. She runs a small tool grinding and key manufacturing workshop. She chose to enter this type of business because there were few other entrepreneurs offering the same services. Oksana has been in business now for 10 years. Her sons are actively involved helping her in this family business. Currently, she has about $2,000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $400-500. Oksana is very enterprising and full of creative ideas. Her reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in her work and have helped to ensure the success of her business. Oksana has a perfect record with “Nadiya Ukraine” having promptly repaid each loan she has received. Oksana is requesting a loan for $600 to purchase billets for manufacturing keys and to purchase some dies, moulds and necessary spares for her tool and cutting grinders. Oksana has also recently launched a new business venture. She built a small greenhouse in her yard and has started growing onions, cucumbers and tomatoes that she will be able to sell. Oksana is planning to invest generated profits from her established business into her greenhouse venture. She believes that having different businesses will help her minimize sales risk and provide stable financial support for her family.

Оксана – одружена, в неї двоє синів. Вона – власниця невеликої майстерні з заточення інструментів та виготовлення ключів. Коли Оксана вирішила займатися цим бізнесом в неї було зовсім небагато конкурентів. Її бізнес існує вже 10 років. Сини Оксани активно допомагають їй з родинним бізнесом. Зараз в неї 2000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає приблизно 400-500 доларів. Оксана – дуже заповзятлива, в неї багато нових творчих ідей. Помірна цінова політика та привітне обслуговування завжди були пріоритетами в роботі для Оксани. Саме ці якості сприяли успішному зростанню її бізнесу. В Оксани – чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”, вона вчасно сплатила усі позики, які отримала в організації. Оксана просить про позику в 600 доларів для того, щоб закупити необхідні матеріали для виготовлення ключів, а також трафарети, шаблони та необхідні деталі для інструментів та шліфувальних верстатів. Оксана нещодавно почала ще один бізнес. Вона побудувала невеличку теплицю біля свого приватного будинку та почала вирощувати цибулю, огірки та томати. Оксана планує вкласти прибуток, отриманий від свого першого бізнесу, в розвиток теплиці. Вона вважає, що різні напрямки бізнесу допоможуть їй знизити ризик продажів та забезпечать стабільну фінансову підтримку для її родини.

loans.use: To purchase billets for key manufacture

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en: Mr Nhanh is 44-years old. His children contracted a skin disease, and he had to sell his house to get money to treat them and pay off a loan from the agricultural bank. The Đưc Linh unemployed and their families usually  go to Ho Chi Minh city to engage with the soil and plant vegetables (water glory). Mr Nhanh was asked to  sell vegetables on the street, but he is frightened of traffic accidents because his legs are not in good shape. So his family returned to Đưc Linh. Because they had no house, the Nhanh family  entered the rubber-making commune Vu Hoa so they could live and plant vegetables. With his first loan from Thien Chi Center (800.000VNĐ) and they were abL. to produce a net profit of 950.000 VNĐ, which enabled him to repay the loan. They are now saving to buy a thatched-roof cottage. Through the Thien Chi Center and KIVA, Mr. Nhanh is requesting a second loan of 1000.000 VNĐ to expand his floriculture business.

loans.use: Grow flowers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has 3 years of experience selling cosmetics and perfumes. She was motivated to start by her sister, who is in the same line of business and experiences success. With the help of a close friend who lent her money, Mary invested in cosmetics and some perfumes. She sells by visiting the homes of family, friends and acquaintances. Like her, the clients she sells too often lack liquidity and they must pay for the products in installments. Part of Mary’s work is to collect on the weekly and biweekly payments owed to her by clients.

May will use the loan to continue to invest in her products. With an increase in products she will be able to offer better variety and increase sales.

Mary is 37 years old and is a native of Guayaquil. Her husband has been working at a nearby factory for about 4 years. They have 2 children together and live in a home made out of bamboo with some concrete. They are slowly improving their living conditions and they make sure to provide an education for their children.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Madame Elizabeth is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and knows about the TEACH Lending program. She requires a loan of $750 to expand her business. She knows how to keep records of her business transactions.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a client of Kraban Support Foudation and needs a loan of $650 to buy a washing machine and also build a permanent structure for her business. She keeps her accounts properly and knows about the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. O. L. is married to a civil servant and has two children. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a loan of $900 to expand her business. She keeps very good accounts of her business and knows about the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba bakes bread for the community. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $700 to expand her business. She knows quite a lot about record-keeping.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima has a stand where she sells typical ecuadorian foods. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years. In order to get started she and her husband had to save money to invest in a cart. She began selling the products right out of her home and she has been very popular for many years. She makes chicken, hotdogs, fries and other foods for people on the go. She is seeking a loan because she needs to invest in a new cart. As one can see from the picture, her old cart is not in good conditions and this hurts the appearance of her business. Fatima is 41 years old and has 4 children, 2 of which are still in school. The other two have already graduated and with their wages from work help out at home. Her husband also works with her as they rely on the business to support their family.

loans.use: Buy a new cart to sell food from

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Only a year ago Jessica was working as a teacher, but due to the low wages and inadequate conditions she was forced to find a new source of income. With her savings she was able to purchase two washing machines, which she used to provide laundry services to local community members. In the short time she has been working she has already acquired several machines and she is growing rapidly. She has set up a room in her home where people can come in and rent the machines for a fee. She is seeking a loan so that she may invest in a drying machine, now that she has plenty of washers. She is 31 years old and is married. She only has 1 daughter who is 6 six years old. Her husband works as chauffeur and truck driver, and on his days off he helps his wife at the business. Their goal is to save enough money to buy a truck for her husband to make deliveries on his own.

loans.use: Buy a dryer

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is 47 years old. She is an experienced hairdresser specializing in the dressing of hair for people in her environment. She is married and blessed with six (6) children. She said the loan would help her expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs. Paulina U. is a trader who sells diesel and kerosene. She is happily married with four (4) children. She is from a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more diesel and kerosene for sale

loans.name: Jamavive

texts.en: A 36-year-old experienced trader, Mrs. Jamevive B. makes foodstuffs available for people in her environment. She will use the loan of $800 to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy E. is a young, dynamic woman of 39 years of age; she is married with three (3) children. Mercy lives in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo state of Nigeria. She started her business in the year 2002. She hopes to get the loan to enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase more equipment for baking

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mrs. Veronica I. specializes in the sale of ice blocks. She started her business in the year 2000. She is married with 4 children and lives in a semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Veronica says that the loan will enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional freezer for ice blocks

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy A. is a 35-year-old woman married with four (4) children. She lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She started her trade in the year 2000 after undergoing training for one year. She solicits the loan for her business expansion and will use the loan to buy more gallons of kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of kerosene for sale

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing A. sells drinks in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with two (2) children. She learned the trade for six (6) months, after which she started her business in the year 2004. According to her, the loan will help her to expand her business. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of water and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of water and drinks for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence E., a 55-year-old woman living in a semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, sells food items for a living. She is married with six (6) children. She will use the loan for the expansion of her food items business and will buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guide my capital to ensure continuity in business. All these are words of Mrs. Theresa I., married with four (4) children. She is requesting for $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Nkem

texts.en: Mrs. Nkem I. is a 38-year-old woman who sells rubber plastic to people. She is married with two (2) children. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the loan to expand her business. With the loan, she will buy more rubber plastic items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rubber plastics for sale

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Mrs. Queen E. is a 32 year old woman with two  children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells plastic containers and drinks to the public. She needs a loan of $500 for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more rubber plastics and drinks for sales

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: "I have owned this business for four years and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 53 years old, my numerous customers always give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Patricia O.. She needs a loan of $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooked food and drinks for sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose O. is a 45 year old woman who has four children and she has had this business for 6 months. She resides in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She requests a loan of $800 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Josephine Isaac

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine  is a 36 years old woman. She is happily married with a child. She is delighted in engaging in sales of provisions and drinks. She is optimistic that her business will improve if given the sum of $500.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & create of drinks

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs Stella I. is 53 years old woman with six (6) children. She sells foodstuffs for the community. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence N. is 45 years of age with seven  children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells cakes, snacks and fruits for the public. She requests a loan of $800 for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and fruits for sale

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya K. is married with two children. She and her family live in Nikopol. After college she started working as a market vendor. Then she changed jobs for awhile and became a storage resource manager. Today she runs a store selling women’s lingerie and terry-cloth. Nataliya repaid the first loan of $500 she received from “Nadiya Ukraine” in 5 months. Lending services have promoted the expansion of her trade and helped her obtain needed inventory. This together with her professionalism, determination, and tenacity has added greatly to the success of her business venture. Nataliya would like to receive a loan of $1,200 to re-stock her inventory and expand her business activity. Nataliya believes that offering a wide assortment of inventory will help her business stand out from her competitors and bring her extra profits. She is hoping to invest generated income into a new business startup. Nataliya wants to become an independent Mary Kay distributor selling cosmetics. She believes that this money-making opportunity will help her achieve greater income and improve her entrepreneurial skills.

Наталія Кубай – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона з родиною живе в м. Нікополь. Після університету Наталія працювала продавцем, потім змінила декілька робочих місць, стала товарознавцем. Зараз вона – власниця крамниці з продажу жіночої білизни та махрових халатів. Наталія сплатила свою першу позику в 500 доларів за 5 місяців. Кредитні послуги сприяли розвитку її торгівлі та допомогли закупити необхідну кількість товару. Позики у поєднанні з професіоналізмом, наполегливістю та загартованим характером Наталії сприяли успішному росту її бізнесу. Наталія хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів та розширити свій бізнес. Наталія вважає, що широкий асортимент товарів допоможе її бізнесу вигідно виділятися на фоні її конкурентів та допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток. Вона планує вкласти отриманий прибуток в новий бізнес. Наталія хотіла б стати незалежним дистриб’ютором компанії Мері Кей та зайнятися продажем косметики. Вона вважає, що ця нова чудова можливість заробляти гроші допоможе їй отримати більший прибуток та відшліфувати власні навички підприємця.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Destiny O. is a young woman of 35 years. She is married with three  children. A LAPO client for over 6 years, she had proved her worth in her line of business. She needs the money ($800) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Mrs. Margaret O. is a 50 year old woman with seven children. She studied her trade for 3 years and finally opened her own business in 2001.$800 is requested to help buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is divorced with two children. After college she had several different jobs, however, she soon realized that her best opportunity would be to have her own business. In 1996 she was able to start a small business selling women’s clothing. Mariya is a very friendly, persevering and hard-working lady. Being a sociable person, she relates easily with her clients. Every time you pass by her kiosk you can find her talking to a new person who will most likely end up buying something. Mariya is requesting a loan for $1,200 to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of suits, jackets, coats and sweaters in bulk for further retail sale. Mariya has proven to be a good steward of the money she has received in the past. We believe she will have no problem managing this loan efficiently and repaying it on time. The loan will be beneficial to her business by promoting its expansion which will further assist Mariya in meeting her household expenses and allow her to set aside some savings for future needs.

Марія – розлучена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона змінила декілька робочих місць, але врешті-решт зрозуміла, що більш за все хоче почати власний бізнес. В 1996 році вона змогла відкрити власну справу та почала торгувати жіночим одягом. Марія – дуже привітна, наполеглива та працьовита. Вона дуже комунікабельна, легко знаходиться спільну мову з клієнтами. Кожного разу, проходячи повз її кіоск, можна помітити, як вона спілкується з новим клієнтом, який просто не зможе піти без покупки. Марія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів. Вона планує закупити костюми, куртки, пальта та светри за оптовими цінами для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Марія довела, що може мудро розпоряджатися грошима, які отримує. Ми віримо, що вона зможе без жодних проблем вчасно сплатити цю позику. Фінансова підтримка позитивно відіб’ється на розвитку бізнесу Марії, сприятиме подальшому зростанню торгівлі, що, в свою чергу, допоможе їй подбати про нагальні потреби родини та заощадити кошти для інших цілей.

loans.use: To increase  stock

loans.name: Dodofiko

texts.en: Dodofiko is married with two children, all at home but ready to join nursery school. He started his business in 2001. He has some schooling. He is an self-employed driver, and he owns a motorbike which he uses for transporting people. This is the only means of transport in the area. He also operates a kinyozi where he has employed a barber. He requests  a loan of $150 from PEMCI, which will enable him to restock his barbershop and repair his motorbike for better operation.

loans.use: To create upgrade his businesses.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Natalya is an enthusiastic and lively entrepreneur. She simultaneously runs two side by side kiosks each selling very different products. In one she offers a selection of wall-paper and in the other she sells small animals and products and supplies for them such as cages, toys and food. Natalya is a delightful retailer whom people trust and respect. She brings much joy to children whose parents buy them small pets and necessary equipment. She assists many people in improving their homes by offering a wide variety of wall-paper in her other kiosk. Natalya’s business strategy of having both kiosks side by side has helped her save the expense of hiring additional personnel to help her with retail. With 10 years of experience running these two different businesses, Natalya continues to reinvest profits into the development of her trade. Also, as a mother, she strives to be successful so that she can see her son graduate from college. Paying for his schooling is currently one of her biggest financial priorities. Natalya is requesting a loan for $500 to expand her assortment of available wall-paper before springtime and the beginning of the big remodeling season in Ukraine.

Наталія – дуже енергійна та жвава. Вона – власниця двох кіосків, торгує зовсім різними товарами: шпалерами, а також їжею та супровідними товарами для домашніх улюбленців, а саме, клітками та іграшками. Наталія – чудовий підприємець. Її поважають покупці, ставляться до неї з довірою. Вона дарує радість багатьом дітлахам, яким батьки купують домашніх улюбленців, а також усе необхідне для них. До того ж Наталія пропонує своїм покупцям широкий вибір різних шпалер, чим допомагає багатьом людям покращити інтер’єр в квартирах. Завдяки тому, що обидва кіоски Наталії знаходяться поруч один з одним, їй вдається обходитися без допомоги ще одного реалізатора, що, в свою чергу, допомагає їй заощаджувати кошти. Наталія займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Вона вкладає зароблені кошти в подальший розвиток торгівлі. До того ж вона допомагає сину з платою за навчання в університеті. Це зараз найважливіший фінансовий пріоритет для Наталії. Наталія просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент шпалер напередодні весняного періоду та початку сезону ремонтів для багатьох власників квартир.

loans.use: To purchase wall-paper

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina O. sells food to the community; a business she started five years ago. She is 40 years old. She has evidence of the impact of a LAPO loan on her business. She requests a $500 loan for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items for cooking

loans.name: Evelyn Naliaka

texts.en: Evelyn is married with eight children, all in primary school. She hasn’t undergone any formal training. She started her business in 1998. She successfully completed her first loan from PEMCI and now requests a second loan for $150 which will enable her to increase her stock and begin a milk business.  Her business talents have gained her recognition in her community, and she is now the head of the Malakisi women group

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 60 year old woman with eight children. She specializes in sales of baby things to the public. With a loan of $800, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is raising two children alone. She has extensive experience in selling children’s clothing and currently manages two sales locations in the market. Both locations have proven to be profitable, yielding Ruzanna around $800 of income each month with $3,000 invested in inventory. Ruzanna relies solely on her income to support herself and her two sons. She has about 4 years of experience in this area of retail and has been excited to witness the growth of her business. She recently made the decision to open a third vending kiosk for children’s clothing and is requesting a loan for $800 to purchase a variety of clothing that will fill the shelves of the new location. She knows that successful expansion will lead to higher profits for the business and in turn a higher income for her family.

Рузанна Аракелян сама виховує двох дітей. Вона має багатий досвід роботи в роздрібній торгівлі дитячим одягом. Зараз в неї дві торгові точки на місцевому ринку. Бізнес Рузанни досить прибутковий, щомісяця вона заробляє 800 доларів, в товар в неї вкладено приблизно 3000 доларів. Рузанна покладається лише на себе у забезпеченні родини. Вона працює на ринку вже 4 роки, її бізнес постійно зростає. Нещодавно Рузанна вирішила відкрити третю торгову точку з продажу дитячого одягу, для чого їй потрібна позика в 800 доларів. Вона планує закупити новий одяг для свого третього кіоску. Рузанна вірить, що успішний розвиток бізнесу обов’язково надасть їй можливість отримати високі прибутки та забезпечити власну родину гідним життям.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace E., a distinguished LAPO client talks about the importance of a  LAPO loan and how it helps the poor in Nigeria. She is married with seven  children and she hopes if given this loan she will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils, Rubber plastics & cloths for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is a business woman who specializes in the sales of bags of water & drinks. She is happily married with five children. She needs  $800 for her business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water for sale

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Able is married with eight children, two of whom have finished their primary schooling. He has received some driver's training. He successfully repaid his first loan from PEMCI. That loan helped him create enough business to buy a small piece of land, a bicycle, and some domesticated animals like goats and cattle. He requests a second loan for $300 to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary D. is married with two children. She is 29 years old and has been a LAPO client for the past 5 years. She enjoys her business of selling clothes and shoes for the community. She is optimistic that her business will improve if given the sum of $800.

loans.use: To buy more cloths and shoes for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria I. is 46 years old with six children. She sells water for the community. She hopes to use her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more water containers for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 38 year old woman with five children who specializes in sale of provisions and foodstuffs to the public. This is a business she started 2 years ago. She requests a $500 loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina O. is an industrious woman who has benefited from a LAPO loan for the upkeep of her children for the past five years. She is married with four children. She promises if given the loan of $800 she will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sales

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs. Paulina O. is 40 years old, a woman full of life who does her business activities all day long through. She hopes to receive a loan of $800 to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more creates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is 40 years old, a trader who deals on the sales of provisions and drinks. She has been doing her business for 6 years now. She is a dedicated LAPO client and also she will use the loan of $500 to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sales

loans.name: Uzo

texts.en: A qualified nurse of a great institution has a chemist shop for the care of people in her community. Mrs. Uzo O. is 32 years old. She is married with a child. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan for business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Mrs. Julie A. is 32 years old, lives in the urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She studied the  fashion business for 6 years after which she opened her her busines in 1999. She is happily married with three children. She is asking for a loan of $800 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines and materials

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy N. who has 6 months training before she  opened her business in the year 2004. She is 32 year old, married with four children. An $800 loan will will enable her to  expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sales

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: 45 year old Mrs. Nkechi F. E. learned the trade of selling paint for 2 years before she started her own business in the year 1999. She is married with eight children and living in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She will use the loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a woman of 38 years old, married with seven  children who lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She started her business in the year 2000. She specializes in the sale of drinks and provisions for the community. She wants to expand her business with the $800 loan.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Mabel
