texts.en: A 36 year old woman, Mrs. Mabel O. is married with five children living in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She learned her trade business for 6 years before she started her business in the year 2002. She is eager to receive a loan of $800 to acquire more goods for sales.

loans.use:
To buy additional sewing machines and 
materials for sale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs. Paulina Umeaka lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is 50 years old, married with seven  children. She started her business in the year 1988. She requests a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and hats for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to expand his commercial dairy farming

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace A. is 52 years old. She started her food and kitchen equipment business 4 years ago. She joined LAPO two years after she started her business with her little savings. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is eager to receive a loan of $800 for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and kitchen equipment

loans.name: Yolanda Patricia

texts.en:
Yolanda is 32 years of age, is married and has a young son attending primary school. Her husband works as a bus driver and his salary is not enough to support his family. Two years ago Yolanda started her business selling used clothing to help her husband with the family's expenses and their son's education.

With your generosity and support this family can have a better life. Yolanda needs a loan of $300 that she will put towards the purchase of clothing for her business so that she may offer a wider variety for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Yolanda tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo que asiste a la primaria, su esposo trabaja como chofer de un autobús y el salario que recibe es muy poco para el sustento de su familia. Desde hace dos años Yolanda empezó su negocio de venta de ropa seminueva para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y así sacar adelante a su familia y la educación de su hijo.

Tu generosidad y apoyo puede lograr que esta familia tenga una mejor vida, Yolanda necesita un préstamo de $300 dólares que utilizará para la compra de ropa para continuar con su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: San Juana

texts.en:
San Juana is a responsible and engaging woman with an enormous desire to pull through with her family. She is 30 years old, is married and has four young children. Her husband's salary isn't sufficient, which is why she decided to start making and selling pizzas door to door. The demand for her products has been increasing and her clients have increased, as have her sales. For this she needs a loan of $250 that she will put towards the purchase of ingredients that she needs to keep expanding her business.

She has struggled a great deal to provide her children with a better education so that they may have a better future and a better quality of life. San Juana and her family needs your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

San Juana es una mujer responsable, emprendedora y con enormes deseos de salir adelante con su familia, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos menores. El ingreso que recibía su esposo era insuficiente, por lo que ella decidió iniciar con la producción y venta de pizzas que ofrece casa por casa, la demanda por sus productos ha ido en incremento y se han multiplicado los clientes y los pedidos, por lo que necesita un crédito de $250 dólares que utilizará para comprar los ingredientes que necesita y continuar creciendo.

Ella ha luchado mucho para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación para que tengan un mejor futuro y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, San Juana y su familia necesita de tu colaboración, ¡Apóyalos!.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 22 years of age, she is married and has a small son. She is a young woman, enthusiastic and wanting the best for her family. She wants to giver her child a life with dignity with all that he needs. She started a business selling lingerie to supplement her husband income that is insuficient to support the family.

She needs a loan of $250 to meet the demand that has recently increase. She depends on the kindness of people to those that need it most. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalinda tiene 22 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, es una mujer joven, entusiasta y que desea lo mejor para su familia. Ella quiere ofrecerle a su hijo una vida digna y darle todo lo que necesita, por lo que inició con la venta de ropa interior, pues el ingreso que recibe su esposo es insuficiente para el sustento de su familia.

Ella necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que necesita para surtir las demandas que se han incrementado últimamente, ella cofia en la bondad de las personas para ayudar a quienes más lo necesitan, y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aracely

texts.en:
Enthusiasm, responsiblity and an entrepreneuril spirit are the characteristics that Aracely possesses. She is single and is 24 years of age. She started her business in shoe sales to help support her family and to meet her expenses. She has great abmitions of self improvement and her dream is to have her own busniess. Aracely is going through some difficult times now and she can't fill her clients' orders, which is why she needs a loan of $250 that she will use to this end.

She is confident that she will be able to pull through this situation and plans to return this loan in a term of three months. Your generosity will be a terrific aid to her. Become part of that dream and give her your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Entusiasmo, responsabilidad y un espíritu emprendedor son características que posee Aracely, ella es soltera, tiene 24 años de edad. Inició con la venta de zapatos para apoyar a su familia, y solventar sus gastos, tiene enormes deseos de superación y así inicia su sueño, de tener su negocio propio. Aracely pasa por momentos difíciles y no puede surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, por esta razón ella necesita de un préstamo de $250 dólares que utilizará con este finella.

Ella confía en poder salir de esta situación y espera devolver el préstamo en un lapso de tres meses. Tu generosidad puede ser de gran utilidad para ella, forma parte de este sueño, apóyala.

loans.use: Purchase merchandises

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard day after day to support her family. she is 31 years old, is separated from her husband and she has custody of her two small children, who are currently attending preschool. Her business selling barbeque has allowed her to provide support for her family, as her husband does not provide them with any kind of support. The income Veronica earns through her business is practically the only source of income that her family can rely on.

And she wants to pull her two kids through, which is why she requests a loan in the amount of $250 to purchase ingredients for the production of her product. You can help Veronica continue on with her business. She depends on your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica se esfuerza día a día por sacar a adelante a su familia, ella tiene 31 años, está separada de su esposo y tiene a su cargo a dos pequeños niños, de los cuales uno ya asiste a preescolar. La venta de barbacoa le ha permitido obtener el sustento para su familia, ya que su esposo casi no les proporciona dinero. El ingreso que Verónica recibe de su negocio es prácticamente de lo único que depende esta familia.

Y ella quiere salir adelante con sus dos hijos, por lo que pide un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 dólares para la compra de la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración y venta de su producto. Tú puedes ayudar a que Vero pueda continuar con su negocio, ella confía en tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Chabwasi

texts.en: Chabwasi is 35 years old, married, and has two sons. He sells goats at a famous goat market in Vingunguti. He buys these goats from wholesalers and resells them retail. Chabwasi learned that he has to buy a flock of more than 15 goats in order to get an adequate profit margin. An average goat is sold at USD 16. Chabwasi is in need of USD 750 as working capital to buy the stock he desires and pay for a hut where the goats are kept before being sold. It is expected that the supply of goats in the country will decrease due to fear of an outbreak of “Rift Valley Fever."

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Deotila

texts.en: Deotila is married with four children. She runs a mens hair dressing business in the busy area of Ilala in Dar es Salaam. She has employed two people for her business. She wants to improve the condition of her business premises by adding enough  chairs for customers to sit in while in queue, a ceiling fan and shaving equipment. She is usually also short of hairdressing materials. The equipment used for hairdressing needs to be highly sterilized to reduce the risk of HIV transmission and other skin diseases. To effectively run her business she needs additional working capital of USD 550.

loans.use: to buy chairs, hairdressing materials and shaving machines

loans.name: Sinahamu

texts.en:
Sinahamu lives in Mtambani in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children. She runs a food vending business near her residence. She wants to improve her business by buying some cleaning and food packaging materials, tables and chairs. 

The supply of cows, sheep and goats is very limited due to the fear of “Rift Valley Fever,” which affects human beings when they consume meat of infected animals. There is an outbreak of Rift Valley Fever in East and Central Africa. Some parts of northern and central Tanzania have also been affected. Sinahamu has decided to add stock of chicken and fish to compensate for the lack of meat. She is in need of USD 750 to facilitate her plans.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is married and has six children. She lives in the Vingunguti area in Dar es Salaam. Suzana is in charge of her family after her husband died three years ago. She owns a food shop near her residence. She sells maize flour, rice, beans, cassava flour and other dry food. 

Suzana has decided to specialize in selling dry food to avoid the risk involved in selling perishable food items. Within the area, she is the only one with a shop selling different types of dry food.

She needs to increase the stock of these items before the rainy season is at its peak. During rainy season the supply of food from the "up country" is mininmal. The rainy season in the coastal areas of Tanzania is from March to June. She is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: to add Stock

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema runs a hairdressing saloon.The saloon is located in a bussy area of Temeke in Dar es Salaam.She has one assistant in her business.In regular days she attends twelve to fifteen customers,but the number increases during weekends .She faces a problem of stock outs of hairdressing and sterilizing materials. Sometimes she has to make the customers wait while she go downstreet to fetch hairdressing materials.The situation which is not desirable in business.Competitors may take this problem as an advantage.To curb such a problem she is in need of USD 400 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is married with one child.She runs a retail shop near her residence selling different consumable items, food in particular.Since she started this shop three years ago,she noticed minimal improvements until she attended “Business and Entrepreneurship training”,from YOSEFO.She is very delighted with the recent improvements.What draws her back is lack of enough working Capital.Due to her weak capital base she is likely to loose some customers as she usually faced with stockouts.To sustain her stock level she is in need of USD 550 to strengthen her working capital.The amount will be used to add stock of some items especially those with high turnover.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow for his commercial dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows for her dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow and build a shed for his dairy business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a second-hand clothing seller and a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is involved with the TEACH Lending program. She also has record-keeping skills. Afia needs a loan of US$700 to buy more new and second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a client of Kraban Support Foundation, is in need of a US$700 loan to build permanent premises for her business. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program and will be able to repay the loan on time because she is good at record-keeping and has a strong committment to her business.

loans.use: Construction of business premises

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn employs three helpers in her workshop. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and understands the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of US$750 to expand her business. Paying back the loan shouldn't be a problem since she knows book-keeping and manages the business well.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Aunty Gladys sells "cocoa drink," a soft drink made from cocoa. She needs a loan of $650 to buy soft drinks and pastries for her business. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has been taught the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of her business properly.

loans.use: working capital.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Madame Helena deals in plastic wares and needs a loan of $750 to expand her business. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also has exprience in book-keeping.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation has Victoria as a long-standing client. She is very good at record-keeping and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $850 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of her business. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $675 to inject into her business. She is very good at keeping records of her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Mrs. Nancy D. is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows basic accounting principles. She needs a loan of $900 to buy hair dryers.

loans.use: Buying Hair-Drying Machines.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has worked with the TEACH Lending program. She also has working knowledge of book-keeping. She needs a loan of $675 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. O. is married with four children. She is in business in order to put her kids through school. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business. She knows a little bit about accounting.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Tess

texts.en: Sister Tess deals in a type of cloth called "Lace". She travels to the urban areas to buy the "Lace" and sells it to community members on credit. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She is also well versed in record-keeping. She needs a loan of $850 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital.

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en: Margeret is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of her business. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She takes care of three children left by her sister who died of AIDS. Sesilia owns two stalls at the Tandika market, which is a famous  market in Dar es Salaam selling used clothes. She sells used clothes for both men and women. Sesilia is planning to increase the size of her stalls and stock of clothes. 

This plan will help her earn extra income to pay for school fees for the children and meet family expenses. Sesilia is an ambitious person and she can’t let an opportunity go. She recently realized that the shoe business is profitable. She wants to open a shoe outlet. She is in need of USD 550 to execute her plan.

loans.use: to add stocks of clothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace owns a butcher shop selling beef and goat meat. She started this business three years ago. She wants to improve the business by  buying a meat grinding machine and a glass display. She noticed that her competitors do not have such equipment and believes this will make her products more attractive, thus giving her a competitive advantage. She also wants to increase the amount of her working capital in order to run her business more effectively. She needs USD 550 to execute her plans.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mrs. Lopez hopes to cover family expenses. Her husband is a bricklayer, but she tells us that the family needs more income, which is why she's been selling sandals, accessories, and clothes for the past 10 years. She says, "For me, it's very important that we don't lack basic needs in the house, so I sell in the popular areas of the city, or outside my house. I would like $800 of support to buy merchandise at volume to increase my sales and receive a bit more money. That way, I can worry less about our monthly expenses."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

La intención de la Sra. L. es contribuir con el gasto familiar, su esposo tiene el oficio de albañileria pero ella nos cuenta que no es suficiente la entrada de dinero, por eso ella lleva 10 años dedicándose a vender sandalias, accesorios y ropa. "Para mi es muy importante que no falte lo básico en la casa es por eso que yo vendo en las colonias populares de la cuidad o afuera de mi casa, quisiera que me apoyaran con $800.00 dlls para comprar mercancía en mayor volumen para lograr subir mis ventas y sacar un poco mas de dinerito, para así quitarme la preocupación que tengo cada mes con los gastos de la casa".

loans.use: Buy sandals, accessories, and clothes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Mr. Martinez is a professional accountant with a great future ahead. Despite having only 3 years on the job, he has acquired enough experience to work on his own. He developed this experience while working and attending school simultanteously. He says, "I hope to succeed professionally and to serve the community in general. To do this, I need a $700 loan to buy equipmemt and to increase my office space."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

El contador M. es un profesionista con un gran futuro, a pesar de sus escasos 3 años de antigüedad, ya ha adquirido experiencia suficiente para trabajar por su cuenta, esta la formó durante el periodo de estancia en la escuela pues desde esas fechas él ya trabajaba a la par de los estudios. "Mi intención es poder sobresalir profesionalmente y servirle a la comunidad en general, para esto necesito un préstamo de $700.00 dlls. Para comprar equipo de trabajo y ampliar mi oficina".

loans.use: Buy office equipment.

loans.name: Marilú

texts.en:
Mrs. "Maru" has 4 consecutive years of experience as a retailer of used clothes. She sells at her house and neighboring areas. Her husband is a parking lot watchman without a salary; he earns tips only. She says, "I want to improve my business. I want to buy bundles of clothes in bulk to have more variety and quantity, which will attract more customers. A $900 loan will be enough to obtain this merchandise."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

Doña "Maru" lleva 4 años consecutivos como comerciante de ropa usada sus puntos de venta son su casa y áreas aledañas, su esposo es velador sin goce de sueldo, solo obtiene lo que la gente le da en los estacionamientos. "Tengo las ganas de levantar mi negocio, deseo comprar la ropa por pacas para tener mas variedad y cantidad para así atraer a mas compradores, con $900.00 dlls será suficiente para obtener esta mercancía".

loans.use: Buy bundles of used clothes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has been selling pharmaceuticals for about 13 years. She decided to set up a pharmacy because there were none near her sector. Her business has done well due to the lack of competition, but she has not been able to meet the demand of the local area. Her lack of capital has not allowed her to sell a large variety of products or offer lower prices. She is seeking the Kiva loan in order to purchase a variety of goods at larger wholesale quantities. Rosa is 38 years old, she is married and has two children. The youngest of her children will be starting school this year. Her priority is to provide them both with an education.

loans.use: Invest in new medicines and other health products

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto owns a bicycle sales and repair shop. He started his business about 13 years ago with the money he saved from a job he had. He has done well with his business, and he has been able to also turn a small part of his shop into a general store. Jacinto will use the money from the KIVA loan to invest in a paper, pens and other supplies now that the school year is about to begin. He is 42 years old and has two children. His wife is a teacher that works at a nearby elementary school. He hopes that with the profits from his general store he will be able to buy more tools for his bike shop.

loans.use: Invest in school supplies

loans.name: Fuentes

texts.en: Azucena is a seamstress who has over 30 years of experience. She has been in this line of since she was 24 thanks to the support of her family. She has been living in this area for about 15 years, where she is well known for the products she makes and sells. She is requesting a Kiva loan because she would like to invest in fabrics and other necessary materials to make uniforms for the upcoming school year. This is the busiest time of year for her and she is hopeful that the capital will help her take advantage of the spike in demand. She is very hopefully that these investments will reap profits that will help her make improvements to the home she lives in.

loans.use: Invest in threads and cloth

loans.name: Freddy

texts.en:
Freddy has an experience of 7 years preparing and selling candies. He began working with a friend delivering bread. With the money he saved in the activity, he decided to buy an oven and moves to work as an independent with his wife. He has been able to begin building his cement house instead of the bamboo wood he had before. He works daily from 7am to 4pm selling the products and from 6pm to 2am to prepare it.

Freddy wants the Kiva loan to be able to buy products for the preparation of the candy, because at this time he is only delivery to schools and request from stores of the area.

Freddy is 34 years old, has 3 kids, two of them are in school already. Hi wife helps him preparing the candy and also works as a teacher in a school. His wish is to be able to improve his house so he can install his business there, because now he only works making deliveries.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes has 5 years experience on her business. She decided to take a course of crafting. Her mom who is in Spain helped her to begin her business creating party souvenirs with just $50. She works everyday of the week from 9am to 6pm.

Mercedes wants a Kiva loan in order to buy raw material to fulfill the requests she has from her neighborhood. Besides she teaches during the weekends and needs materials for her students.

Mrs. Mercedes is a single mother, who has 3 kids, and has been able to provide them education. She wants to finish her house to improve the space where she has her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make party decorations

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Mrs. Laura has 20 years experience as a seamstress. She began working for someone else, but she began studying and taking courses. With the money saved she bought a sawing machine and began working in her house. Little by little she got more clientele because of her good customer service. She works everyday from 8am to 8pm, and when she has classes she stays working even later.

Laura needs the Kiva loan to buy raw material like clothes and threads, because currently she has some request but is not able to finish all because of lack of materials.

Laura is a single mother with 3 kids who are all in school. She has been able to support her home thanks to her work. She is looking to buy an industrial sawing machine and with it improve her profit.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy threads, cloth and other materials

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia has an auto body shop on her house. She began her business with her husband’s help who gave her $150. She began selling small automobile parts and repairing tires. Now she is still selling auto parts and oil, and other auto products. Clemencia wants the Kiva loan to buy new products at wholesale prices and improve her profit. She has faith that with new products her business will grow. Clemencia has 2 children and is 3 years old. Clemencia has hope that with the Kiva loan her family’s quality of life will improve as she will be able to have more stability and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Invest in tools and materials

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo has a wood workshop in his house. He began working with a friend who was his teacher. Once he learned it very well he decided to work by himself. At the beginning he only built chairs but now he offers beds, sofas, and other furniture. Primitivo has 10 years with his business and has been able to employ several people of his community. Primitivo wants to increase the diversity of his products. He will use the loan to buy wood and therefore satisfy the demand of retail stores who are his biggest clients. Primitivo is married, and he is 5 years old. And he is convinced that this loan will improve his family economic level and keep on growing his business to generate more employment.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Simón

texts.en:
Mr. Guzman has tried for several years to expand his business, but he hasn't yet been able to. He is asking for a loan to acheive this expansion. He says, "My wife and I have been able to maintain the business, but we aren't advancing. We are asking for a $1200 loan to build a stand."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

El señor G. lleva varios años tratando de expandir su negocio, hasta la fecha no lo ha logrado, el solicita el apoyo para dar ese salto. "Entre mi esposa y yo hemos podido mantener el negocio pero no estamos avanzando por lo que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para construir un puesto".

loans.use: Increase business size.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Don Felipe is applying for his second loan with Kiva and Mifex. He runs a stand at very popular and large market where he predominantly sells seafood. When he received his first loan Don Felipe ran into an opportunity to add chicken and cheese to the products he sells. He does not sell these items from his stand though because the capital allowed him to do much more. He was able to buy a large amount of these products and be a distributor to other store and stand owners. He and his wife still run the stand, but Don Felipe has been able to improve his income greatly now that he can also be a distributor. He is applying for his second loan so he can continue to expand and buy products wholesale.

loans.use: Buy seafood, chicken and cheese wholesale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos sells encebollados (seafood soup), arroz con menestra (rice and beans) and bollos (seafood tamales). Carlos began his business with only $100, and he only used to sell encebollados. Now he is offering more products like ceviche mixtos (mix seafood cocktails) and chuzos (shish kabobs). Carlos wants to have a diner and bbq restaurant because in his area there is non. He would use the Kiva loan to invest buying kitchen tools and chairs to expand his business. He has faith that with this new service he will have several happy clients. Carlos is 47 years old and he and his couple hope that this loan will bring him some economic stability and will be able to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy kitchen tools and chairs to expand his business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Mrs. Maclovia has 4 years experience on her small school. She worked for 12 years on a seamstress workshop that closed. With her liquidation money and with her sister who is a teacher they decided to establish a school. They work from Mondays to Fridays from 6.50am to 2pm. Maclovia wants the Kiva loan to invest in uniforms that would be sold to their students, as well as school materials. Maclovia is separated from her husband for 2 years already. She has a kid who studies on the same school, which is of Christian formation. With the revenue her business provides she wants to save to buy the land were it is, as she is renting now.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Make uniforms for students

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria has 3 years experience selling groceries. She opened a grocery store with her husband with a family loan. Little by little has been able to get a good clientele. Her business is open 7 days a week from 6am to 8pm. She wants the Kiva loan to increase her inventory because a little bit ago her father in law passed away and her husband, as older child, paid all the funeral expenses, which reduced their capital. Mrs. Maria is 35 years old and is married with 4 children, 3 of them are in school already. Her husband is a welder who works under request. Together they have been able to improve their home, and they wish to finish building their home as some of it is still made of bamboo wood.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Wants to increase her groceries inventory.

loans.name: Quyet

texts.en: Mr. Quyet mends punctures and operates a food processor for people. His business is not as successful as it used to be because there is more competition. The Quyet family also raises rice with an average yield of about two tons a year. After they eliminate the production costs, the profit is not very high. Mrs. Quyet) sells fruit when she has the money to buy stock.  Mr. Quyet is requesting a loan of $50 from Thien Chi Center and KIVA so they can expand open a business selling products for the home, which will add to their other income streams.

loans.use: Buy stock for home products business

loans.name: Hau

texts.en: Mr Hau used to roast pork for his wife's business in the market of Đong Ha commune. But their pigs and cattle contracted hoof and mouth disease, which ruined their business. They produce a small amount of rice -- 1-2 tons a year, which does not provide enough money for them or their children to be properly nourished. They have a 2-month old daughter and two children in school. Sometimes their other older children are able to send a little money home, but not on a regular basis. Their modest house is placed at a busy intersection surrounded by a high concentration of people. Mr. Hau is requesting a loan for $75.00 from Thien Chi Center and KIVA so that they can open a small bazaar in their home which will draw customers from the dense population in their area, and increase their income so they can properly nourish and care for their children.

loans.use: To open a small bazaar

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Six years ago, with her mom’s help, Juana opened a small grocery store in her own house. She is a widow, and has three kids who continue to study; she considers it is very important for her children to finish college. Two years ago, her mom passed away, and since then she has been in charge of her business on her own. She’s been through very difficult times. In order to allow her children and business to get ahead, Juana is requesting a loan in the amount of US$750 to purchase merchandise, and have more variety of products to offer to her customers.

You can help this business continue to grow, so her kids have a better quality of life, and finish school. Your generosity will be very helpful, go ahead and support this family.

Hace 6 años, con ayuda de su mamá, Juana inició su negocio de abarrotes instalándose en su propio domicilio, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos que continúan estudiando, porque considera que es muy importante que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria. Hace dos años murió su mamá y ella se quedó sola a cargo del negocio, pasó por momentos muy difíciles. Para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y su negocio, Juana solicita un crédito por la cantidad de $750 dólares para poder comprar mercancía y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Tú puedes apoyar a que este negocio siga creciendo, que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad vida y lleguen a la culminación de sus estudios, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda, decídete a colaborar con esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is married and has three kids. Her husband retired seven years ago, and her family has been through very difficult times because the money from his pension is not enough to cover their expenses. She decided to open her small grocery store because of the need to have an extra income to support her family. Her children help her with the store. Evelia is requesting a loan in the amount of US$475 to stock up her store and continue to grow.

It has not been easy to overcome the obstacles; however, with the family’s closeness and efforts they have been able to do it. Now they need your support, and they thank you for your generosity. You can help, don’t hesitate any longer.

Evelia es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo se jubiló hace siete años y su familia pasó por momentos muy difíciles, pues el dinero de la pensión que recibe su esposo es muy poca para cubrir sus gastos, la necesidad de tener un ingreso extra para el sustento de su familia hizo que ella comenzará su negocio de abarrotes, en el cual le ayudan sus hijos. Evelia requiere de un préstamo de 475 dólares para poder surtir su negocio y continuar creciendo.

No ha sido fácil superar todos los obstáculos pero con la unión y esfuerzo de toda la familia han salido triunfantes de éstos. Ahora necesitan de tú apoyo, y agradecen tu generosidad, tú puedes ayudar, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Five years ago, Arturo started his business of making and selling furniture, a skill he learned from his father. The support he receives from his two children and wife is what has kept him going, and motivated to overcome the problems that arise. Everyday Arturo works hard so that his business can grow, and he can give his family a decent living. Lately, the demand for this furniture has gone up, and Arturo does not have the money to buy the materials he needs, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$750 that he will use for this purpose.

Arturo needs your support and generosity; he thanks you for your help. You can support him, help him grow and keep going. He and his family will be sincerely grateful.

Hace cinco años Arturo inició con su negocio de elaboración y venta de muebles, habilidad que aprendió de su padre. El apoyo de sus dos hijos y el de su esposa es lo que le ha incentivado a continuar y superar los problemas que se presentan. Día a día Arturo se esfuerza para que su negocio pueda crecer y poder ofrecerle una vida digna a su familia. Últimamente la demanda por sus muebles se ha incrementado pero Arturo no cuenta con el dinero para invertir en los materiales que necesita, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $750 dólares que utilizará en esto.

Arturo necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad, agradece que puedas ayudarlo. Tú puedes apoyarlo, ayúdalo a crecer y a continuar, el y su familia te lo agradecerán sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.en:
The wish to see her family get ahead motivated Martha to open her store. Two years ago she became unemployed, and started selling clothes and used products. Then, she decided to invest her income in imported products. Martha is married. Her husband is a welder, and the money he earns is not enough to support their family. Martha wants to help their family, and to offer a better life to her two-year old child; she found this way to do it.

Martha needs to increase her sales of imported products, and is requesting a loan in the amount of US$925, so she can offer her clients a wider variety of products and better service. Martha needs your support, and thanks you for your generosity.

El deseo de salir adelante con su familia impulsó a Martha a iniciar su propio negocio. Hace dos años quedó desempleada y comenzó a vender ropa y cosas usadas, con el ingreso que obtuvo decidió invertir importaciones. Martha es casada, su esposo trabaja de soldador, el dinero que él obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia. Martha quiere ayudar a su famita y ofrecerle mayor bienestar a su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad, ella encontró esta manera para hacerlo.

Ahora, Martha necesita un préstamo de $925 dólares para incrementar su venta de importaciones para ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad y un mejor servicio. Martha necesita de tu apoyo, y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase imported products

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married, and her husband is a self-employed electrician. They have four kids, two of which are very young and dependent on their parents. She is a nurse, and is interested in having a business related to health. A year and a half ago she found some natural health products, which help prevent diseases. She had already tried other products, and the last ones she found are the ones she believes in. Her clients like them a lot, and there is a high demand for them.

She already has a pretty big amount of orders. However, she first needs to invest in order to provide variety. For this reason, Martha is requesting a loan in the amount of US$925, which she hopes to pay back in six months. You can help this business grow, go ahead and support her.

Martha esta casada, su esposo es electricista y trabaja por su cuenta, tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son pequeños y dependen directamente de sus padres. Ella es enfermera y le interesa tener un negocio de salud, hace año y medio encontró unos productos naturistas que le ayudaban a prevenir enfermedades, ya había probado otros productos y éstos son los que a ella le han convencido. Por lo que han tenido gran aceptación y demanda de sus clientes.

Ya tiene un pedido suficientemente grande de estos productos pero primero tiene que invertir para que sea surtido, por lo que Martha requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 dólares que espera devolver en el transcurso de 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a que este negocio crezca, apóyala.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Peter Alfred

texts.en: Peter is married with seven children who are in both primary and secondary schools. He grew up as an orphan and dropped out of school at the primary level, because he had to become a casual laborer to survive. He started a shop in 1996, but it went under due to family problems. He then restarted it  in 1999, and with the help of PEMCI last year, he has been able to stabilize his business. He is requesting another Loan from PEMCI and KIVA. He will use this money to add more stock and diversify by including tobacco sales in his business, which he will sell to B.A.T. Peter is now supporting his family and educating his children.

loans.use: To expand and diversify business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: M. is a single mother of two young girls. She dropped out of primary school because her family did not have the money for her fees. She started her hawking business in 2001 with an initial capital of four dollars given to her by her husband. Now that she is more business experienced, she requests a loan of $300 from PEMCI and KIVA. This will enable her to increase her stock sufficiently to supply areas of the neighboring country with household goods such as blankets, cooking pans, detergents, etc. at reasonable Kenya prices. Miriam depends on her business to pay for her children’s school fees and their general upkeep. She is optimist who looks forward to opening up a shop in Mbale Uganda.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: I am a single man, head of a household of five people. I am a Petty Trader and the main bread winner. I deal in the selling of second-hand books. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents due to HIV/AIDS in 1997.

loans.use: I will use the loan to expand my business.

loans.name: Kalenda

texts.en: I am a married man and father of 7. I do my business in Bumala in the Busia district. I am the main bread-earner for my family. I deal in and repair second-hand electronics. I believe the loan will help me increase my business skills and educate my dependants.

loans.use: I will use the loan to widen my businesses.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: I am an orphaned teenager. I sell used clothes part-time in order to cater for my needs and pay my school fees. I believe the loan will help me achieve my dreams of finishing school.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: I am a married man, father of 5. I sell used clothes to earn a living for my family. I believe the loan will help me expand my business and be able to cater for my family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: David

texts.en: I am a single man. I dropped out of school due to lack of school fees. I am the breadwinner in my family. I believe the loan will help me diversify and expand the business and be able to meet our basic needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: I am a married man, father of 4. I sell cheap electronics to earn a living for my family. I am the main breadwinner. The loan will help me expand my business and be able to cater for my family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en: I am married, father of 6. I sell used socks for a living, and I am the main breadwinner for my family. The loan will help me expand to a more viable business.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: I am a widow, mother of 7. I sell mangos to earn a living for myself and my children. The loan will help me diversify and expand the business so as to be able to cater for my family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: I am a single parent, mother of 4. I sell groceries to earn a living for myself and my children. The loan will help me diversify and expand the business so as to be able to pay school fees for my children.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Evaristus

texts.en: I am a married man, father of 3. I sell cheap electronics for a living. I am the main breadwinner for my family. The loan will help me expand my business and be able to cater for my family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.
