loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is married with two children. She lives in the Pugu area of Dar es Salaam. She keeps cows for milk production. She has employed two assistants to help with the cows. She supplies milk to various restaurants and nursery schools in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam.

The place where she keeps the cows is very far from where she supplies the milk. She wants to buy two new bicycles and vessels that will facilitate the supply of milk.

Together with this business she grows vegetables which she sells to small retailers. Her businesses are symbiotic; the droppings from animals are used as manure for the vegetables. She wants to stock enough medicines to treat vegetables against micro organisms during the rainy season, which lasts up to June. Cows are also very vulnerable to diseases during the rainy season, so she needs to stock enough medicines. The two businesses need USD1000 as working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru runs a cosmetics shop in a busy area of Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam. She has three years in this business. She has good sales in her shop, which is favored by her business location and regular customers.

The size of the stock she keeps is small due to small capital. As a result she is usually faced with stock outs, which are not desirable in business. Nuru is in need of USD400 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija runs a cold drinks pub in a well located premises. Due to hot weather in Dar es Salaam, sales are higher.

The big drawback is the small capacity of the fridge she posesses. Hadija wants to buy a deep freezer to run her business effectively. She is currently losing some of her customers due to this problem. Hadija needs USD550 to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: Buy deep freezer

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica owns a butcher in Temeke market in Dar es Salaam, which is different from other butcher shops. She buys cows from wholesalers, slaughters them, sells some of the meat to other butcher shops, and sells the remainder herself. She has been in this business for six years now.

She want to buy more animals to enjoy economies of scale. Previously she used to buy and slaughter four to five animals at a time. She wants to increase the number the number of animals up to ten. She is in need of USD1200 to subsidize her working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Monica's business has grown so steadily for the past fews months, and now wants another loan to boost her business

loans.name: Cassa

texts.en:
Cassa lives in the Mtambani area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two sons. Cassa is in a food vending business. She has four years in this business.

She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs, food serving dishes and a stock of cold drinks. Sometimes she loses some customers due to inadequate equipment. She is also in need of a cupboard for keeping food serving dishes hygienically. To facilitate her plan, Cassa needs USD400.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuima is married and has two children. She lives in the Kombo area in Dar es Salaam. Mwajuma runs a food vending business in an industrial area of Dar es Salaam. She sells cold drinks, breakfast and lunch mostly to industrial workers. Mwajuma has received entrepreneurship and business training from Hans Said Foundation and Equal Opportunities Trust Fund (EOTF) in Dar es Salaam.

She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables, food serving dishes and a stock of cold drinks. To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD550 as working capital. Amina’s dream is to have one day a professional catering business.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables and food serving dishes

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili owns a hairdressing salon in a busy area of Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam. The salon is well situated and thus fetches a lot of customers. She has built a strong relationship with her regular customers who act as ambassadors to new ones. As a result she has more customers than she can serve.

She wants to employ one more assistant to the two she currently has, add a stock of hairdressing materials, driers and chairs. To facilitate this plan she is in need of USD750.

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Pili has payed back the former balance and she is  now in need of a bigger loan

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married and has two children. She lives in the Kombo area in Dar es Salaam. Leah owns a small canteen near the Dar es Salaam Harbour. She sells cold drinks, breakfast and lunch mostly to harbour workers.

Leah has received entrepreneurship and business training from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO) in Dar es Salaam. This training has helped her a lot. She knows how to keep records of her business and utilize opportunities that come around.

In usual working hours her business is normally flocked with customers in need of services. Inadequate facilities hold her back. She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables, food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks. To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD750 as working capital. Leah's dream is one day to have a professional catering business.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and food saving dishes

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is married and has two children. She lives in the Kombo area of Dar es Salaam. Saida sells fried fish near her residence. She collects fresh fish from the Indian Ocean shores, spices and fries them ready for resale.

She wants to make her business attractive by improving the sanitary condition of her business premises. The display cage and aluminium wrapping materials will make her business attractive. This will enable her make more sales and thus more profit. Next year her first-born will join secondary school. The increased income will enable her save for school fees. To implement her plan she needs USD550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janet sells cows in a famous Pugu cow auction in Dar es Salaam. She buys cows from the Central regions of Tanzania, loads them in trucks and offers them wholesale to businessmen who slaughter the animals and sell the meat. She has been in this business for four years now.

She wants to buy more animals to enjoy economies of scale. Previously she used to hire a truck with her business colleagues in order to share transport charges. This limited the number of animals she could buy at a time. She is now planning to hire the whole truck by herself so that she can buy a reasonable number of animals. She is in need of USD1200.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 56 and her family has 7 people. Most of the family must work for somebody, but still their income is only $10 per person per month, which is not enough.  Her youngest child is a student in secondary school. The family must pay for this schooling.  Mai wants to support her family by selling vegetables at her small shop in the local market.  Her husband, a farmer for the last nine years, wants to begin growing these vegetables, but as yet cannot afford the seed or fertilizer.  Mai's family hopes to get a loan so that they will be able to buy seed and fertilizer, and keep their youngest child in school.  They believe that they will be able to repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: she will buy fruits and vegetables, and after that, she will sell them in the local market

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is divorced with two children. She lives with her family in Nikopol, a city in the central part of the Ukraine. After college, Alla decided to work as a market vendor so she started her own business selling women’s blouses and shirts in the local market. Alla received her first loan for $500 from “Nadiya Ukraine” and paid it back in six months. She has received and promptly repaid 20 loans since then. Her perseverance and enthusiasm along with access to financial resources have helped her small business grow and be successful. Alla is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her turnover capital. She is planning to invest in seasonal French cuff shirts, knit tops, tunics, tanks, camisoles and short sleeve silk blouses which she can get at low wholesale prices. Alla believes that a wide assortment of clothing items will help her meet her customer’s needs and provide superior service. Satisfied customers will be more likely to return to buy from her kiosk and will also speak positively about her business to others, leading to further growth in her sales.

Алла - розлучена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона з родиною живе в місті Нікополі, яке знаходиться в центральній частині України. Закінчивши університет, Алла вирішила піти торгувати на ринок, почала власний бізнес з продажу жіночих блузок та сорочок на місцевому ринку. Алла отримала першу позику в 500 доларів від „Надії України” та сплатила її за шість місяців. З того часу вона отримала та сплатила вже 20 позик. Її наполегливість та ентузіазм у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допомогли її бізнесу зрости та досягти успіху. Алла просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити свій зворотній капітал. Вона планує закупити сезонні сорочки, в’язані жилетки, туніки, жакети та шовкові блузки з короткими рукавами за оптовими цінами. Алла вважає, що широкий асортимент одягу допоможе їй краще задовольняти потреби покупців та обслуговувати їх. Задоволені клієнти не тільки обов’язково повернуться до неї по покупки, але й позитивно озиватимуться про її бізнес, що, в свою чергу, призведе до подальшого розвитку торгівлі.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married and has two sons, one of whom is physically challenged. A college graduate, she runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the central city market in Kherson. She believes that one of the biggest advantages of her work is a flexible schedule that gives her the opportunity to take good care of her disabled son. Olga has been in business for seven years. She has promptly repaid a total of seven loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Her attentiveness and creativity have helped her develop a good understanding of what her clients need and want. They always feel complimented when she goes out of her way to help them with their selections. This has naturally boosted Olga’s sales and led to growth in her business. Olga is requesting a loan for $1,000 to enable her to significantly expand her business by purchasing a new vending facility. She is also planning to re-stock her existing kiosk and purchase a supply of inventory for her new vending location. Olga is hoping to reinvest generated income into further expansion of her business. She believes that consistent growth will help her provide a stable source of income and continue to secure her family’s well-being.

Ольга – одружена, в неї двоє синів. Один з них – інвалід. Ольга має вище освіту. В неї є власний бізнес з продажу жіночого одягу на центральному ринку міста Херсон. Найбільшою перевагою свого бізнесу Ольга вважає гнучкий графік роботи, який дозволяє їй дбати про свого сина-інваліда. Ольга займається цим бізнесом вже сім років. Вона вчасно сплатила усі сім позик від „Надії України”. Її дбайливість та творчий підхід допомогли їй порозумітися з багатьма клієнтами. Покупцям дуже приємно бачити, як Ольга прагне якомога краще обслужити кожного з них. Саме її підхід до роботи сприяє зростанню обсягів продажу та розвитку її бізнесу. Ольга просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб значно розширити власний бізнес завдяки придбанню нового торгового приміщення. Вона також планує поповнити асортимент товарів для роздрібного продажу. Ольга сподівається вкласти отриманий прибуток в подальший розвиток її бізнесу. Вона вважає, що поступове зростання торгівлі забезпечить стабільне джерело прибутку та гарантуватиме добробут її рідних.

loans.use: To buy a new vending facility

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita and her husband live in Ivano-Frankivsk which is located in the western part of the Ukraine. After high school she began working as a market vendor. However, Vita had a desire to start her own business so she opened a small kiosk selling children’s clothing in the central city market. She has now been in business for 6 years. Vita has a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has promptly repaid 18 loans that she has received from the organization. Lending services have promoted the consistent expansion of her small business. Currently, she has about $3,000 in working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $1,000. Vita is requesting a loan for $1,200 to increase her inventory of clothing. She is planning to purchase 40 pajamas, 60 t-shirts, and several hundred pairs of socks. Vita believes that a good assortment of clothing items will attract many customers, increasing her sales profits and helping the success of her business. Vita is hoping to invest generated income into the further expansion of her business and eventually open a new vending facility.

Віта та її чоловік живуть в Івано-Франківську, це місто знаходиться в західній частині України. Віта певний час працювала на ринку реалізатором. Однак, вона хотіла почати власний бізнес. Отже, вона відкрила кіоск з продажу дитячого одягу на центральному ринку. Віта займається цим бізнесом вже 6 років. У Віти чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”. Вона вчасно сплатила усі 18 позик, які отримала від організації. Кредитні послуги сприяли поступовому розвитку її малого бізнесу. Зараз в неї приблизно 3000 робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає приблизно1000 доларів. Віта просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити обсяги товару. Вона планує придбати 40 піжам, 60 футболок та декілька сотень пар шкарпеток. Віта вважає, що широкий асортимент одиниць одягу привабить багато покупців, допоможе їй збільшити прибутки та сприятиме успішному зростанню її бізнесу. Віта сподівається вкласти отриманий прибуток в подальший розвиток її бізнесу та врешті-решт відкрити власну крамницю.

loans.use: Increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Mikhayil

texts.en:
Mikhayil is a graduate of the Moscow Law School. For over ten years he worked as an investigator. Seven years ago he decided to resign and start his own small business. He now operates a little kiosk selling women’s clothing in one of the busiest local markets. Mikhayil currently has about $2,000 of working capital and his monthly gross revenue amounts to $1,000. His business is the only source of income for his family. Mikhayil is a very responsible and enterprising business owner. These qualities have helped him repay 5 loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Mikhayil is also very cheery and eager to meet the needs of his customers. This helps him create a positive perception of his business and leads to satisfied, repeat customers. Mikhayil is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase 80 sets of pants and 100 skirts to re-supply the clothing inventory for his kiosk. A variety of good quality, classy dresses, suits and pants will help boost his sales and generate additional profit. Mikhayil believes that his business and marketing abilities in combination with financial assistance will help him increase his income and success.

Михайло закінчив Московську Академію внутрішніх справ. Десять років він працював слідчим. Сім років тому він вирішив піти з роботи та почати власний бізнес. Зараз Михайло – власник маленького кіоску з продажу жіночого одягу на одному з найбільших місцевих ринків. В Михайла приблизно 2000 робочого капіталу, його місячні доходи складають 1000 доларів. Бізнес – це єдине джерело прибутку для усієї родини Михайла. Михайло – дуже відповідальний, жвавий та заповзятливий підприємець. Ці якості допомогли йому сплатити 5 позик, які він отримав від „Надії України”. Михайло завжди намагається задовольнити потреби клієнтів. Завдяки цьому в нього дуже гарна репутація серед покупців, вони повертаються по покупки до нього знову й знов. Михайло просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів в кіоску, а саме, придбати 80 пар штанів та 100 спідниць. Широкий вибір високоякісного одягу, класичних суконь, костюмів та штанів сприятиме росту обсягів продажу та допоможе отримати додатковий прибуток. Михайло вірить, що досвід, отриманий в сфері бізнесу та маркетингу, у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможе йому збільшити прибутки та досягти ще більшого успіху.

loans.use: To get assorted inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He would use part of the loan to buy the wood and materials necessary to cover his clients’ orders. The other part would be used to purchase tools, since the ones he has are in bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invertirá el crédito en la compra de materiles y en la remodelación de su negocio para crear una sala donde pueda mostrar sus productos terminados.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would use the loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials and of a machine that would improve the appearance of wood and thus raise the quality of her products.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Mr. B. R. is a primary school teacher in the “Flor de Sacuanjoche” Academic Center and, for more than five years, has been the owner of an appliance repair shop. He would use the credit to buy tools and materials that would allow him to make his shop more professional and increase his income; because Nicaraguan teachers receive low wages, it would be impossible to improve his family’s economic conditions through teaching.

loans.use: He would use the money to purchase tools and materials that would allow him to improve the quality of his services and increase his clientele.

loans.name: Avila

texts.en:
B. has a mini-bazaar where she sells gifts for all occasions, materials for painting fingernails, and school supplies. She was motivated to start her business by her mother-in-law, who gave B. use of a small space in her store so that she could launch her own business. Her husband helped her procure the products. He works selling the same products in the street.

She would use the loan to buy school supplies because the back to school season is about to begin. With the additional earnings, she will be able to expand her business.

B. is 22 years old, with one daughter. Her husband works selling school supplies in the street. Although they are a young couple, they are very hardworking and very motivated to get ahead. B. dreams that her business will grow and she will be able to own her own parcel of land some day.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

B. tiene un mini bazar donde vende regalos para toda ocasión, materiales para pintar uñas, y útiles escolares. Ella fue motivada por su suegra ya que ella tiene una tienda y le cedió un espacio para que se inicie su negocio. Su esposo le ayudó con el material para que se inicie en la casa. Él también trabaja vendiendo estos mismos artículos pero en la calle.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares porque la temporada se inicia. Con los ingresos generados podrá incrementar su negocio.

B. tiene 22 años. Con 1 niña. Su esposo trabaja vendiendo en la calle útiles escolares. Son una pareja joven pero muy trabajadores dispuestos a salir adelante. Su sueño es que sus negocios se incrementen y algún día tener su terreno.

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Geomar

texts.en:
Geomar has a tailoring workshop where she sews clothing, particularly sports uniforms and clothing for social events. She has 22 years of experience as a seamstress, and 8 years in her own workshop. She tends to her clients every day from Monday through Sunday, especially when there is a lot of work. She generates additional income by printing images on the clothing. She also take advantage of her freezer to sell ice and colas.

With the loan, she will buy her raw materials: cloth, buttons, elastic, and artwork for the printing. With the additional earnings this investment will generate she hopes to renovate a part of her house for her business and workshop.

Geomar is 40 years old, with 3 children. Her husband has worked as a machine operator for 30 years. She and her husband mutually support each other. They are an enterprising couple; both have worked since they were very young. They have their own cement house. Geomar's dream is to continue working in order to generate more income and improve the business, and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Geomar tiene un taller de costura donde cose especialmente uniformes deportivos y para eventos sociales. Su experiencia es de 22 años. Con su taller propio 8 años. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Lo atiende permanentemente de lunes a domingo especialmente cuando hay mucho trabajo. Además ella realiza estampados en la ropa y esos son otros ingresos para ella. Ella también tiene un congelador que lo ha aprovechado para vender hielo y colas.

Ella comprará su materia prima: tela camiseta, botones, elástico, pintura para los estampados. Con estos ingresos adicionales que generará desea adecuar un espacio en su casa para el local.

Geomar tiene 40 años. Con 3 hijos. Su esposa trabaja como operador de máquina desde hace 30 años. Su esposo y ella se apoyan mutuamente, son una pareja emprendedora que han trabajado desde muy jóvenes. Ellos tienen casa propia de cemento. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para generar ingresos y mejorar el negocio y que sus hijos terminen su colegio.

loans.use: Invest in raw materials

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a business selling all sorts of household items: cooking pots, sets of dishes, glasses, silverware, awnings, matched sets of bed linen, DVDs, pans for cooking rice, etc. He has 4 years of experience as the owner of his own business. He learned about the business in his previous work since he was a salesman and collector of debts. He travels through the streets selling his products and keeps a register of his sales and credit. With the money he received when he left his previous job he was able to save enough to buy his first articles for sale. Running his own business has allowed him to generate more income for his household.

Francisco needs the loan in order to buy new products such as blenders, irons and fans, the products with which he has the most success and which are easy to market. The income he generates will allow him to buy additional products.

Francisco is 34 years old with 2 children. His wife works as a teacher at a neighborhood school. They are a very hardworking couple and support each other mutually. He has his own house, although it is still made of cane; he has not yet been able to improve it with cement. He hopes to increase his earnings in order to support his children in their studies. He also hopes to make improvements to his cane house.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco tiene un negocio de ventas de todo tipo de artículos para el hogar como: Ollas, vajillas, vasos, cantina, cubiertos, toldos, juegos de sábanas, DVD, Olla arrocera etc. Tiene 4 años de experiencia y como dueño de su negocio 2 años. Él aprendió de su trabajo anterior ya que era: vendedor, recaudador. Su negocio es ambulante recorre las calles y registra en sus tarjetas de cobro. Con su liquidación pudo ahorrar y comprar sus primeros artículos. Con su propio negocio le ha permitido generar mejores ingresos para el hogar.

Él necesita para comprar ciertos como: licuadora, planchas y ventiladores, que son productos de mayor salida y fácil colocación. Los ingresos generados le permitirá comprar otros artículos.

Francisco tiene 34 años, con 2 niños. Su esposa trabaja como maestra en una escuela del sector. Ellos una pareja muy trabajadora que se apoyan mutuamente. Él tiene casa propia y de caña todavía. Su deseo es mejorar sus ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. También desean hacer cambios en su casa que actualmente es de caña.

loans.use: Invest in products including household appliances

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has a beauty shop in her home. She started her business 12 years ago working out of her mother's home and visiting her clients' homes. Recently Sonia has taken the opportunity to sell cosmetics and perfumes to her beauty shop clients. This gives her a second source of income to support herself, since she is alone.

She would use the loan to make investments in the new products that she sells, such as perfumes, make-up and accessories, since these are her best-selling products. With these additional earnings she would like to make improvements to the shop in order to attract more clients.

Sonia is 41 years old and has 2 children. She is the only source of income in the household, since her husband abandoned her and left her with full responsibility for the family. Unfortunately one of her sons has a motor disability. She does not have sufficient resources to invest in a special school for him. She aspires to increase her earnings in order to support her children and give them an education.

Translated from the Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia tiene un gabinete de belleza en su domicilio. Ella empezó su negocio hace 12 años realizando su actividad desde el hogar de su madre y también haciendo visitas a clientes fijos. Recientemente Sonia también ha visto la oportunidad de vender cosméticos y perfumes a los clientes de su gabinete. Esto le da una segunda fuente de ingreso para poder ser sustente de su hogar ya que ella es sola.

Ella usara el préstamo para hacer inversiones en los productos nuevos que vende, como perfumes, maquillaje y bisutería, ya que estos son los productos que mas se vende. Con estos ingresos adicionales que genera quiere adecuar el local para atraer más clientes.

La señora tiene 41 años y tiene dos niños. Ella es la única fuente de ingreso en su hogar ya que su marido la abandono y la dejo a cargo de la familia. Desafortunadamente un hijo de Sonia tiene una discapacidad motriz, pero ella no tiene suficiente recursos para ingresarlo en una escuela especial. Aspira poder incrementar los ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos y darles educaciones.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell to her clients in her beauty shop

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona has a business selling all types of gifts for girls' quinceañeras, baptisms and weddings. She also sells school supplies. She has one year of experience. She took out a loan from a lending institution to start her business. The business is in her home and she tends to it every day of the week.

She would use the loan to buy school supplies since the school season is starting. With the earnings she generates she will be able to make improvements to her business premises.

Ramona is 31 years old. She has 3 children. Her husband abandoned her 5 years ago. She was not able to make ends meet with the monthly payments her husband was sending her, so she had to look for another solution. Currently she is both mother and father for her children. Her desire is to grow the business in order to be able to keep her children in school and continue making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ramona tiene un negocio de venta de todo tipo de regalos para: quinceañera, bautizo, matrimonio, también vende útiles escolares. Tiene una experiencia de 1 años. Ella saco un préstamo en una institución que brinda este servicio. El negocio lo tiene en su misma casa y lo atiende todos los días de la semana.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar: útiles escolares que se inicia la temporada de clase. Con los ingresos generados podrá hacer mejoras en su local.

La señora tiene 31 años. Tiene 3 niñas. Su esposo la abandono hace 5 años. Con las mensualidades que su esposo le mandaba no le alcanzaba y tuvo que buscar que hacer. Actualmente ella es padre y madre para sus hijos. Su deseo es incrementar el negocio para poder mantener a sus hijos en la escuela y seguir adecuando su casa.

loans.use: Buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria and her husband have had a small store in their home for 13 years. With effort, they succeeded in saving a little capital in order to sell food products from the coast and the mountains, such as rice, sugar, meats, oil, tuna, various legumes, and others. They work in the store every day of the week, serving customers from 6 AM to 10 PM.

Maria would like the loan in order to buy a horizontal glass display case so that she can add more variety to her business by offering cosmetics and bazaar items. She would hold direct responsibility for administrating this new business, leaving management of the existing store to her husband. This way Maria will avoid taking capital out of the store. Even better, she will generate additional income and will be fulfilling the needs of her clients.

Maria is married. She is 36 years old. She does not have children, but three years ago the son she had adopted when he was 1 day old died, drowned, at the age of 10. She is not able to have children for medical reasons. Her husband supports her in everything; they are responsible people. Her desire with the loan is to generate higher earnings which will allow her to continue making improvements to her home and give her more security since it is located in a dangerous area.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria junto con su esposo tienen una pequeña tienda desde hace 13 años ubicada en su domicilio. Con esfuerzo lograron ahorrar un pequeño capital para vender víveres de costa y sierra tales como: arroz, azúcar, carnes, aceite, atún, legumbres varias y otros. El negocio lo trabajan todos los días de la semana atendiendo al publico desde las 6AM-22PM.

Maria desea el crédito para poder comprar una vitrina horizontal, para así surtir su negocio con artículos de bazar, cosméticos. Ella seria la encargada directa de administrar este nuevo negocio quedando la dirección de la tienda para su esposo. De esta manera Maria evitaría quitar capital al negocio de la Tienda. Más bien generaría otros ingresos y cumpliría con las necesidades de sus clientes.

Maria es casada, tiene 36 años. Ella no tiene hijos, pero hace 3 años tuvo un hijo que falleció ahogado a la edad de 10 años el cual era adoptado desde un día de nacido. Ella no puede fecundar por problemas de útero. Su esposo la apoya en todo ya que son personas responsables. Su anhelo con el préstamo es generar mayores ingresos que le permitan seguir adecuando su vivienda y darle mayor seguridad ya que están ubicado en zona peligrosa .

loans.use: Buy a glass display case

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna S. is married and lives with her husband in the town of Pavlograd in central Ukraine. After going to college to become a teacher she couldn’t find a job in her field. Her family was facing a tough financial situation at the time so she decided to take a risk and start her own small business. Today Anna runs a small kiosk selling shoes in the local market. Anna is a determined entrepreneur. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Anna recognizes that financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine” has provided significant support for her business and has promoted its stable growth. Anna is requesting a loan for $1,200 to increase her turnover capital which will allow her to re-supply her inventory and increase her sales. Eventually, Anna is hoping to rent a bigger vending facility and open her own little shoe store. She believes that financial assistance in combination with her zeal, perseverance and diligent work will someday help her dream come true.

Ганна – одружена, вона живе з чоловіком в м. Павлоград, що знаходиться в центральній частині України. Після закінчення педучилища вона не могла знайти роботу за спеціальністю. В її родині склалося дуже важке фінансове становище. Отже, Ганна була змушена ризикнути та почати власну справу. Зараз в неї є невеличкий кіоск з продажу взуття на місцевому ринку. Ганна – дуже цілеспрямований підприємець. Вона вміє досягати поставленої мети. Ганна розуміє, що фінансові послуги „Надії України” є значною підтримкою для її бізнесу й сприяють стабільному зростанню торгівлі. Ганна просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити зворотній капітал, поповнити асортимент товарів та збільшити обсяги продажів. Врешті-решт, Ганна сподівається орендувати більше торгове приміщення та відкрити власну крамничку з продажу взуття. Вона вважає, що фінансова підтримка у поєднанні з її старанністю, та наполегливістю допоможе їй здійснити її мрію. На фото Ганна зображена з іншою клієнткою – Іриною Федоровою – яка також звернулася за позикою для розвитку підприємницької діяльності.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman lives with his wife and daughter in Berdansk, a city on the Sea of Azov. He runs a small business selling automotive lighting systems and accessories. He has been in this business for six years and has been quite successful. Currently, Roman has about $6,000 of working capital. His monthly gross revenue amounts to $3,000. Roman is a very polite and affable businessman. His kiosk offers a variety of exclusive, good-quality inventory. Exceptional prices and a willingness to make sure that his customer’s needs are met help him stay competitive and maintain repeat clientele. A nice, convenient location for his business also adds to the success of his trade. Roman is requesting a loan of $1,000 to remodel his vending pavilion and purchase some additional inventory. He is planning to buy some new shelves and stands, paint and insulate the walls of his pavilion and purchase assorted headlights for further retail sale. He believes that financial assistance in combination with his hard work and perseverance will contribute much to the successful growth and increased profitability of his business.

Роман з дружиною та дочкою живе в м. Бердянськ, що знаходиться на березі Азовського моря. Роман торгує автомобільною оптикою та аксесуарами. Він займається цим бізнесом вже шість років, досяг неабиякого успіху. Зараз, в Романа приблизно 6000 доларів робочого капіталу. Його щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 3000 доларів. Роман - дуже ввічливий та привітний бізнесмен. В його кіоску завжди широкий асортимент ексклюзивних, якісних товарів. Виняткові ціни та намагання допомогти покупцеві допомагають Роману залишатися конкурентноспроможним та зберігати постійних клієнтів. Зручне розташування бізнесу також сприяє успіху його бізнесу. Роман просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб зробити ремонт у своєму торгову павільйоні та закупити більше товару. Він планує придбати нові полиці та стенди, покрасити та утеплити стіни павільйону, розширити асортимент фар для подальшого роздрібного продажу. Роман вважає, що фінансова підтримка у поєднанні з наполегливою працею сприятимуть успішному розвитку його бізнесу та підвищать його рентабельність.

loans.use: To do remodeling in his vending facility

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married and has a grown son. He runs a small business providing personal vehicle owners and enthusiasts with vehicle related products. Currently, he has built up around $6,000 in working capital and has a monthly net profit of around $500. Sergey is very knowledgeable and professional in his trade and relates well with his car-loving customers. He tries to conduct his business to provide a minimum hassle experience. Sergey has a talent for making every customer feel valued and appreciated, even after the sales process is complete. Many times he will offer after-sales help such as assisting with an installation. This also helps him stay competitive in a tough auto parts sales market. Sergey would like to receive a loan of $1,200 for a couple purposes. First of all, he is planning to do some electrical improvements to his vending facility. Secondly, he would like to get a better supply of spare parts to sell, such as radiators, crankshafts, generators and starters for different types of vehicles. Sergey believes that good parts availability and reasonable prices will help many of his clients obtain the items they need and accomplish their repair goals, which will help him maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business.

Сергій – одружений, в нього є дорослий син. Він – власник бізнесу з продажу автозапчастин та аксесуарів. Зараз в Сергія приблизно 6000 робочого капіталу, щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 500 доларів. Сергій знається на своїй справі, дуже професійно підходить до роботи, ввічливо обслуговує кожного автолюбителя. Він намагається не завдавати зайвого клопоту покупцеві. Його клієнти відчувають, що їх цінують та піклуються про них, навіть після укладання угоди. Часто Сергій пропонує своїм покупцям допомогу з встановленням обладнання. Саме ці якості допомагають йому залишатися конкурентноспроможним на ринку торгівлі автозапчастинами. Сергій просить про позику в 1200 доларів, бо в нього декілька цілей. По-перше, він планує покращити електричне оснащення свого торгового приміщення. По-друге, він хотів би закупити більше автозапчастин, а саме, радіаторів, коленвалів, генераторів та стартерів для різних видів транспортних засобів. Сергій вважає, що широкий вибір автозапчастин та помірні ціни допоможуть багатьом клієнтам отримати необхідні матеріали та зробити потрібний ремонт, а йому, в свою чергу допоможуть утримати лідируючу позицію на ринку та розширити власний бізнес.

loans.use: To improve his vending pavilion and purchase inventory

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two grown children. She runs a small business selling infant supplies in the local market. There are very few other entrepreneurs involved in this area of sales so it has been a good business for her and meets the needs of many customers. Presently, Valentina has about $2,000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $600. Valentina does her best to please her customers in every detail. She is very professional and always tries to have accurate knowledge about her products. These qualities in combination with financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine” have promoted the success of Valentina’s business. Over the 11 years she has been in business she has repaid 17 loans without any delinquencies. Valentina is requesting a loan for $1,000 to help her buy a new vending facility. She has already found a good location for a new kiosk and is planning to supply it with an inventory of diapers, milk bottles, bibs, towels, and clothing. Valentina believes that the infant supplies she can offer will make parents lives a lot easier, their babies happier, and will help many moms and dads use their baby supplies budget wisely.

Валентина – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Вона торгує товарами для малюків та немовлят на одному з ринків міста Бердянськ. В цій сфері торгівлі працює небагато інших підприємців. Саме тому бізнес Валентини успішно розвивається, в неї багато покупців. Зараз у Валентини приблизно 2000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 600 доларів. Валентина намагається якомога краще обслужити кожного покупця. Вона професіонал в торгівлі, до усього підходить із знанням справи. Ці якості у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою від „Надії України” сприяли успіху бізнесу Валентини. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже понад 11 років, сплатила 17 позик без жодних прострочень. Валентина просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове торгове приміщення. Вона вже знайшла гарне місце для свого нового кіоску, зараз планує поповнити асортимент товарів, а саме, закупити підгузки, пляшечки, рушники та одяг. Валентина вважає, що товари для немовлят зможуть значно полегшити життя багатьох батьків, забезпечити усім необхідним їхніх малюків, а помірні ціни допоможуть розумно використати гроші з сімейного бюджету.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mpato would like to buy 5 steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Taraiya would like to buy 3 steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Taiyo would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her bead-work business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a renowned General stores operator for the paast 16 years. She has been selling ladies and gents footwear for the past years. She has recently joined the Kraban Support Foundation and has participated in the TEACH lending programs to improve and sharpen and business records keeping skills. She has requested for a loan of $925 from KIVA to strengthen her business capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Mr. C. has been making and selling ice cream for 25 years. He and his wife sell the ice cream using two tricycles and traveling the city's main thoroughfares. "Thankfully, we are never short of work but we would like to improve and excel. With the loan money we want to create more jobs and, to do so, I would like to buy work equipment. I'm asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to begin my plans."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor C. tiene una experiencia de 25 años en la elaboración y venta de nieve, entre él y su esposa realizan las labores de venta, su medio de transporte son dos triciclos que con ellos recorren las principales arterias de la ciudad. "Gracias a dios nunca estamos escasos de trabajo pero si deseamos mejorar y sobresalir, con el apoyo que estamos solicitando pretendemos generar empleos, quisiera comprar mas equipo de trabajo para cumplir con mi objetivo. Les pido un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para comenzar con mis planes".

loans.use: To buy work equipment for two more people.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is in the beginning phases of starting her micro-enterprise. She learned the basics of how to make sandals some time ago, but due to the lack of capital she has not been able to establish the activity as a stable source of income. About a month ago, she decided to attend the sandal-making courses offered at our offices in order to improve her skills and possibly progress toward a loan.

She makes the sandals in a small part of her home, but she is hoping that a loan will help her set up a workshop where she can be more productive. She also hopes she can invest in materials such as leather straps, soles, glue and other items necessary for the process.

Maritza is a mother of two children. Her daughter is 17 and often helps her in the sandal-making process. Her son is 15 and is still attending high school. The father of her children passed away about 11 years ago. Maritza has been able to support her family with jobs as a domestic worker, but she was not satisfied with the wages and the time she had to spend away from her children. She is now in a new relationship with someone who is very supportive of her idea to start a new business. She is very optimistic about the future thanks to the loan and the sandal-making opportunity.

loans.use: Invest in the materials necessary to make sandals and also build a workshop for production

payments.comment: Maritza made all of her payments to Mifex on time and in full. She is now working on a second loan with our institution.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
"Toñita" owns a grocery store that is her only source of income. Children from the area go to her store to buy candy. She is very respected and loved by old and young alike. "I am lucky to be surrounded by wonderful people who appreciate me. This motivates me to continue. I want all of these people to be able to find what they need in my store. That's why I want to buy more products and more variety, and why I need a loan of $800.00. I would be forever grateful."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña "Toñita" cuenta con su tienda de abarrotes, es su única entrada de ingresos, los niños de las colonias acuden muy seguido a comprar golosinas, es muy respetada y querida por los grandes y chicos. "Tengo la fortuna de estar rodeada de gente bonita que me aprecia y eso me motiva a seguir, me gustaría que toda esta gente encontrara en mi tiendita lo que necesitan, por eso quiero surtirla con mas variedad y cantidad de productos para esto necesito que me proporcionen un crédito de $800.00 dlls. Se los voy a agradecer infinitamente".

loans.use:
To buy more goods and a greater variety of these goods.
Comprar variedad y cantidad de mercancia.

loans.use: Agnes Wanjiru intends to purchase a dairy cow

loans.use: Rose Njeri intends to purchase 20 bags of cereals

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has one daughter. After her schooling she couldn’t find a good-paying job so she decided to become self-employed. Today she runs a little kiosk selling men’s outerwear in the local central market. She has been in this business for two years. Tatyana has proven to have the heart of an entrepreneur and is enthusiastic about her small business. Her exceptional prices, positive attitude and cheery, smiling face attract many customers. Tatyana has very good reputation with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has promptly repaid 12 loans in the past. In the last two years her turnover capital has increased to $600. She would like to get a loan for $700 to supplement her available capital. This will allow her to introduce some new clothing items and purchase assorted inventory. Tatyana’s responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize her as a consistent and serious entrepreneur who is capable of loan repayment.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї одна дочка. Вона певний час не могла знайти гарно оплачувану роботу, а отже, вирішила працювати на себе. В неї є невеличкий кіоск з продажу верхнього чоловічого одягу, розташований на місцевому ринку. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже два роки. Тетяна має справжній талант підприємця, вона з великим ентузіазмом розвиває свій бізнес. Вигідні ціни, чудове ставлення до кожного покупця та широка посмішка на обличчі приваблюють багато клієнтів. В „Надії України” в Тетяни склалася гарна репутація. Вона вчасно сплатила усі 12 попередніх позик. За останніх два роки її робочий капітал збільшився на 600 доларів. Тетяна хотіла б отримати позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб поповнити свій капітал. Завдяки їй вона зможе придбати новий одяг та поповнити асортимент товарів. Відповідальність Тетяни, стабільне зростання її бізнесу та чудова кредитна історія характеризують її як поступового та серйозного підприємця, який спроможний сплатити чергову позику.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married and has two grown daughters. She has quite a varied work background. After finishing her schooling she worked for awhile in construction applying stucco finish to walls and buildings. Later she changed jobs and became a cleaner in an office building. The money she was making was not enough to support the basic needs of her family, however, so she decided to start her own business. For the last five years, she has had a small vending kiosk selling children’s clothing in the central city market. It is the only source of income for her family. Katerina realizes the value of lending services which have promoted growth and contributed to the success of her small business. She has maintained a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”, repaying a total of ten loans. Currently, she has built up around $2,000 of working capital. Her monthly gross profit amounts to $800. Katerina is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy assorted inventory. She is planning to refresh her clothing supply with a variety of pajamas, t-shirts, socks and other clothing. One of Katerina’s long-term plans is to open a new vending facility in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk. She believes that her optimism and tenacity in combination with financial assistance will continue to move her toward success and higher profits.

Катерина – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дочок. Вона змінила багато місць роботи. Закінчивши школу, вона певний час працювала в сфері будівництва штукатурницею. Потім змінила роботу, працювала прибиральницею. Однак, грошей, які заробляла Катерина, катастрофічно не вистачало, щоб забезпечити нагальні потреби її родини. Саме тому вона вирішила почати власний бізнес. На протязі останніх п’яти років вона є власницею торгової точки з продажу дитячого одягу на центральному ринку міста. Цей бізнес є єдиним джерелом прибутку для усієї родини. Катерина розуміє, що кредитні послуги сприяли розвитку її малого бізнесу та допомогли їй досягти успіху в бізнесі. У Катерини чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”, вона вчасно сплатила усі десять позик. Зараз в неї приблизно 2000 доларів робочого капіталу. Щомісячний дохід складає 800 доларів. Катерина просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів. Вона планує закупити нові піжами, футболки, шкарпетки та інший одяг. В майбутньому Катерина планує відкрити нову торгову точку в Івано-Франківську. Вона вважає, що її оптимізм та наполегливість у поєднанні з фінансовою допомогою допоможуть їй і надалі досягати успіху в бізнесі та отримувати стабільний прибуток.

loans.use: To get assorted inventory

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel operates a phone use service in her surbub. She is a long-standing client of Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH lending skills training. Mabel requires $950 to improve her business operations.

loans.use: Mobile and Accessories

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Small community retail outlets are quite a vibrant activity  in Angie's community, Madina, in Ghana. Angie is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been trained in the TEACH lending model. Angie is now able to keep simple records of her business. She requires a loan of $800 from KIVA to support her retail outlet operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rance D.

texts.en: Farming is a frowned-upon venture for most university graduates in Ghana. However, Rance has taken it upon himself to cultivate vegetables, black pepper, tomatoes, and other produce to support his family. He also sells produce to his community to supplement the family income. He requires a loan of $900 to improve his farming business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Shabani

texts.en: Shabani sells dry fish at Temeke market in Dar es Salaam. He has been in this business for four years now. Shabani buys these fish in the nearby region of Morogoro, packs them and transports them to the market. Buyers of his fish are retailers at the Temeke market. He has built a healthy relationship with his regular customers. These retailers place regular orders to him and when he has enough orders he arranges the trip to Temeke market. For the past six months he has been receiving more orders than he can service. This is due to the weak capital base he has. This is a competitive disadvantage for him. Competitors may capture and utilize the opportunity. He needs USD 750 to add to his working capital so that he can service all the orders he receives.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with four children. She also takes care of her mother; her dad died five years ago.

Amina sells different kinds of snacks to various restaurants in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam. These snacks include samosas, buns, sausages, eggs, and the like. She has been in this business for six years now. She has regular customers for her products. Sometimes she prepares snacks for ceremonies like weddings, baptisms and holy communions. She recently forecast a demand increase for her products from her regular customers. She wants to subsidize her working capital with USD400 to meet the rising demand.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Mr. Hernandez has a small carpentry business. He mainly produces curtain rods but wants to be able to produce larger quantities of other types of furniture in order to earn more. "I have in mind specializing in at least 5 types of home furniture and selling my products house to house in the busiest areas of town. In order to do this, I need $1,200.00 to buy raw material and indispensable equipment to carry out these jobs."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. H. tiene una pequeña carpintería su principal articulo de elaboración son los cortineros, él quiere abarcar en mayor cantidad otro tipos de muebles para que le produzca mejores ganancias. "Traigo en mente especializarme en por lo menos 5 tipos de muebles para el hogar así podré salir a la calle a vender mi producto casa por casa en los sectores mas populares de la localidad, para esto necesito un apoyo de $1,200.00 dlls para comprar materia prima y parte del equipo indispensable para efectuar estos trabajos.

loans.use:
To buy equipment and raw material.
Para comprar equipo y materia prima.

loans.name: Maria Expectación

texts.en:
Mrs. C. y T. is a grocery story owner on the west side of town. She would like to have more inventory to offer her clients a greater variety of products. She says, "I would like your support for my little store. I need more merchandise to sell. I need more household basics, but I can't do it alone. I need your help and I think that with $1200, I can have my store well stocked."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. C. Y T. es propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes en el poniente de la ciudad ella desea contar con mas inventario para ofrecerle a sus clientes mas variedad de productos. "Quiero que me apoyen con mi tiendita necesito mas mercancía para vender me faltan muchos artículos indispensables para la casa, pero yo sola no puedo requiero de su atención creo que con $1,200.00 dlls tendré bien surtida mi tienda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. César V. works making sheepskin jackets, vests and jackets, according to the season (winter or summer). Like many Bolivian microentrepreneurs he markets his products in various cities and rural zones outside La Paz. His clothes-making workshop is located on Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz Avenue in the city of La Paz, where he lives. He is 52 years old and has been self-employed for more than 20 years. He has 3 sons. His wife assists him in the manufacture, distribution and sale of his products. With this work César creates employment directly and indirectly, that is to say, he has 2 employees he pays by the piece, and his children work in cutting the cloth and making clothing. His sells his products by the dozen; they reach the public through small distributors (indirect employment).

This is the tenth time that César has come to Impro for a loan. His case history in the institution describes him as "client 1": excellent fulfillment of his obligation and the repayment of his loan. The loan for which he is currently applying would be used in the purchase of cloth, closures, thread and other raw materials for the tailoring business. His work and previous credit history with Impro allows him access to this loan, since he has work experience which will generate the earnings with which to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Cesar V., se dedica a la confección de chamarras, chalecos, parcas de acuerdo a la estación que se tenga (Verano – Invierno), como muchos pequeños microempresarios bolivianos comercializa su producto en varias otras ciudades y zonas rurales fuera de La Paz. Su taller de confección se halla ubicado en la Avenida Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz de la ciudad de La Paz, lugar donde también vive. El tiene 52 años y trabaja por cuenta propia hace mas de 20 años, tiene 3 hijas y su esposa es ayudante de confección y distribución y ventas.

Cesar con esta actividad genera fuentes de empleo directo e indirecto, es decir tiene 2 trabajadores a destajo y además sus hijas también trabajan en corte y confección. Sus ventas son por docena y llegan al público a través de comerciantes minoristas (empleo indirecto). Esta es la 10ma vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito.Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado a la compra de tela, cierres, hilo y otros insumos propios de su actividad. Su trabajo, y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo

loans.use: Working capital to buy materials with which to make clothing

payments.comment: payments of $42 each were made  on may3,2007 and June 4, 2007
Early pay off. Cesar is applying for another loan.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela sells sweets and candy from a stand in the street, like many merchants in Bolivia. Her sales stand is located on America Street in the city of La Paz. She is 52 years old and has been self-employed for more than 10 years. She has 4 children and her husband is a bricklayer.

This is the second time that Rafaela has come to Impro for a loan. Her case history in the institution describes her as "client 1": excellent fulfillment of her obligation to repay her loan. The loan for which she is currently applying will be used to urgently rebuild a retaining wall in her home, which is located on the western slope of the city of La Paz (the poorest part of the city). The intense rains have knocked down the retaining wall of her home.

Her work and her previous credit history with Impro allow her access to this loan, since she has experience in her business, which will bring the earnings to repay the loan.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rafaela, se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas en un puesto de la C., como muchos pequeños comerciantes en Bolivia.Su puesto de venta se halla ubicado en la C. América de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella tiene 52 años y trabaja por cuenta propia hace mas de 10 años, tiene 4 hijos y su esposo es obrero albañil.

Esta es la 2da vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito.Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado a la urgente refacción de un muro de contención de su vivienda ubicada en la ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz (la más pobre de esta ciudad), debido a que por causa de las intensas lluvias se le ha derrumbado el muro que su vivienda tenía. Su trabajo, y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito de emergencia, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Repair damage to her home caused by the effects of the rainy season

payments.comment:
payments of $17 each were made on May 3, 2007 and June 4, 2007.
Client is current.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. S. has a truck that he uses to make freight deliveries to other cities. He has been doing this work for over 18 years. Now he wants to purchase another vehicle for the same use. He says, "My son has followed in my footsteps and is interested in helping me with work, but we only have one vehicle, so I am asking for a $1200 loan to buy another little truck."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. S. cuenta con una camioneta que utiliza para realizar fletes a otras ciudades, lleva haciendo esto por mas de 18 años, hoy en día quiere adquirir otro vehiculo para darle el mismo uso. "Mi hijo siguió mis pasos y esta interesado en ayudarme con el trabajo solo que no tenemos mas que un solo vehiculo por lo que les solicito $1,200.00 dlls. para comprar un camioncito.

loans.use: To buy another work truck.

loans.name: Juana Elva

texts.en:
For the past 24 years, Juana has been making handcrafts. It is her talent for this type of work that has helped her stay in this business for so long. She is woman who is not afraid of challenges and who is completely dedicated to her job. Juana’s income is the only support she has for her young son and her mother, who lives with her. The demand for Juana’s products is increasing and she cannot cover the cost of the materials she uses in her work. This is why she needs a $200 loan.

Juana Elva needs your support to continue working. She is confident that her family and business will succeed. She plans to return the loan within 3 to 6 months. Juana and her family need your support and are sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 24 años Juana se dedica a la fabricación de manualidades, su habilidad para la elaboración de este tipo de trabajo la han ayudado a permanecer por tanto tiempo en este negocio. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica por completo a su trabajo, además, el ingreso que obtiene representa el único sustento para su pequeño hijo y para su madre que vive con ella. La demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado y no puede cubrir el costo de los materiales que utiliza para elaborar sus manualidades, por lo que necesita de un préstamo de $200 dólares que utilizará con este fin.

Juana Elva necesita de tu apoyo para poder hacer su trabajo. Ella confía en que podrá sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio, por lo que planea devolver el crédito en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Juana y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo y agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.en:
María Dolores is an active and enterprising woman. Five years ago she opened a stationary store to support her family. She has three children and she wishes to give them the best, especially now that they are studying. She hopes that they can finish school smoothly. The income her husband earns is not enough to cover the family’s expense, this is why María decided to open her own business and also, she could take care of her children at the same time.

Now, María needs a $475 loan so she can stock her store with more merchandise and proviD. a better service for her clients. María would like to see her business continue growing and for this, she needs your help. Support María!

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

María Dolores es una mujer activa y emprendedora, desD. hace cinco años inició con su papelería para poder apoyar a su familia, ella tiene tres hijos y desea darles lo mejor sobre todo ahora que ellos están estudiando, ella espera que puedan terminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente. El ingreso que recibe su esposo es insuficiente para el gasto familiar, razón por la que María decidió abrir su negocio propio ya que así podía también cuidar a sus hijos.

Ahora María necesita D. un crédito D. $ 475 dólares que planea utilizar en la compra D. mercancía para surtir su negocio, y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella quiere continuar creciendo, esto depenD. D. ti, D. tu ayuda, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.en:
Martha is divorced and has to take care of her two sons. The alimony her husband gives her is not enough to cover all of her and her family’s expenses. For this reason, she began to sell natural products to earn extra income and help her two sons succeed. It has been four years since she began with her sales. Now, she is getting more orders since she has gained her clients’ trust because of the good quality of the her products. To cover the meet the demands, she needs a $200 loan to buy more merchandise.

The well-being of this family is in your hands, you can be an important part of Martha and her family’s achievements. It is the moment to help those who are most in need and they are truly thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Martha es divorciada y tiene a su cargo a dos hijos, la pensión que le confiere su ex esposo es muy poca para todas las necesidades que tiene ella y su familia, por esto Martha comenzó a vender productos naturales, con la finalidad de tener un ingreso extra y sacar a adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos. Ya son cuatro años desde que ella inició con sus ventas, y ahora se han incrementado los pedidos, Martha se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes por los buenos productos que comercializa, y para poder cubrir la demanda ella necesita de un préstamo de $200 dólares que utilizara en la compra de mercancía.

El bienestar de esta familia esta en tus manos, tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Martha y su familia, es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, ellos agradecen tu apoyo sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Olfio

texts.en:
Olfio A. is a farmer from a rural town named Salitre. He is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but it is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Olfio, has been farming for most of his life. He was born and raised in the rural sector and has been making a living out of agricultural production since he was old enough to work. He, his wife and their children all play a vital role in the farm. He mainly produces rice, but he also has cattle as a secondary source of production. He is optimistic about the potential use of this loan.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural area in the Province of Guayas which is known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to rice farming and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year during the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous area despite its rural location. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in the fact that many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention force.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding during the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worst when El Niño occurs, rice farmers lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Invest in rice production

payments.comment: 2do pago de aso, resistencia de salitre

loans.name: Pedro

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter S. is a rice farmer in rural Salitre. He is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. Walter has been farming rice with his family his entire life. On his plot of land he also has some fruits such as papaya and pineapple. As a second source of income Walter raises cattle. He needs the loan because of the bad water situation in his land. He hopes he can invest in a good watering system in order to improve his production.

loans.use: Teresia Wangui Lesit intends to expand her business premises and buy about five bags of cereals and other household goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah Kurende Lepulei intends to buy beads and more tools to make this work a success

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose Wangui Kagia intends to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joan Wanjiku Mwaura intends to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy Wambui Gitau intends to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann Nyakeru Gichohi intends to buy household goods in bulk for the retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mineh Muthoni Gitahi intends to buy a dairy cow and buy household goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia Wambui Mutura intends to buy a dairy cow and renovate the cow shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Christine Njeri Ndungu intends to buy a dairy cow and buy 20 bags of cereals and other household goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify used book business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is thirty two years old, married, and has one child. She owns a telephone card business and a small food service. She started her businesses in 1997 with only US$61. Mamie learned through her friend about Hope’s Microfinance program and decided to join the group. She has been a faithful client with Hope. Mamie needs US$500 to purchase more phone cards to meet the demand. Her business is helping many people in the community that do not have phones. She is trying to improve her services that are enjoyed by many clients in her neighborhood. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and a wholesaler in her community.

loans.use: To purchase phone cards for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en: Anne Marie was born on December 12, 1955. She is married and a mother of eight children. She sells women’s clothing, shoes, handbags, beverages and purified water. She started the business in 1968 when she was fifteen years old by selling firewood. In the meantime, Anne has gained experience in different kinds of businesses.  Currently, her business is popular in the area. Anne has managed to increase her clientele, but she is not able to fully meet the demand, which is why she needs US$1200. Her current business capital is US$2312. She especially wants to increase the sales of purified water, which is highly demanded and very important for the health of people in her community.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of purified water and women’s clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: During all his professional life Ivan S. had been working as a driver. But in 2001 he and his wife lost their jobs. Then he started own business. Ivan rented a hall and using  his wife’s professional experience he started a small confectionary workshop. Ivan’s special products are biscuit cakes. Production is not so large but is sufficient for Ivan and his family. Now Ivan needs a $ 1200 loan to buy a new special oven and to increase the variety of candies that he produces.

loans.use: To buy a new special oven

loans.name: Kebadio

texts.en: Kebadio is married and has nine children. She is among the oldest women in Hope’s Microfinance program in the Democratic Republic of Congo, but still strong, bright, and doing well with her business. She was born on December 25, 1945, and started her business in 1961 by selling corn from the fields. Kebadio is requesting US$900. She wants to expand her business and provide much better service to her community. She intends to double the variety of beverages offered from 10 to 20, and to purchase a large stock of rice, beans, sugar, milk and basic foods that are in high demand from her clientele. Kebadio's long-term plan is to purchase a plot of land where she could build a store.

loans.use: Food sales such as fish, beans, rice, sugar, salt, milk, canned food and drinks

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en: Dimitar B. has been in the agricultural business for more than 15 years. He and his family live in the village of Cherven, Smolian district, where his farm is. Dimitar breeds 19 cows and 7 calves. He also breeds two horses and has his own tractor. The animal fodder he needs he grows on his own land. Now Dimitar needs to change his old milking machine to a newer one and so he is asking for a loan of $1 200.

loans.use: To change his old milking machine to a newer one

loans.name: Rosen

texts.en: Rosen S. and his family live in Asenovgrad. Previously he has worked as a driver but after the transport company closed he started his own farming business. Rosen bought a cowshed and started cow breeding. Now he breeds 29 cows and 7 calves. Rosen also has a milk station where he buys extra milk from other farmers in region. Because of enlargement of this, Rosen S. needs to make some repairs on this station and needs $1200.

loans.use: To make some repairs on his milk station

loans.name: Vana

texts.en: Vana is a mother of six children, born on December 11, 1949. She is a widow and is running her business to support the family. She started her business in 1980 with US$50 by selling 5 crates of soft drinks. After she lost her husband, she decided to open a restaurant in order to support her family. Vana excels in this business and has managed to gain a large clientele. They like her dishes and the service she provides. With a loan of US$500 Vana intends to purchase a large stock of rice, corn, manioc and chickens, the basic goods used in the preparation of her dishes that are enjoyed by her clients.  Vana’s long term plan is to purchase a plot of land where she can build a new restaurant.

loans.use: To increase the stock of food products and to ensure good service in her restaurant clients

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ifoly

texts.en: Ifoly is a hardworking young man, born on January 5, 1982. He started his first business in 2002 with US$100. His activities include running a corn mill and a phone booth. This business has helped Ifoly to pay for his university studies: he has been studying Business at the local university. His services are helping many families in his community. However, the capacity of the current mill (10 horsepower) is not sufficient to meet the clients' demand. Ifoly is requesting a loan of US$1000. He is planning to purchase a 30-horsepower mill which would be efficient and capable of meeting the demand generated by the increasing number of clients.   His dream is to make business his life-long career.

loans.use: To buy a 30-horsepower mill

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tatuka

texts.en: Tatuka, born on March 24, 1970, is married and a mother of 4 childre. She lives in an isolated area on the outskirts of the city where there are very few shops. Her shop is very popular. She is a very hardworking woman who started her business in 1991 with only US$4. In spite of the political and economic instability of the 1990s in the Congo, which caused the closure of many businesses, Tatuka did not give up her business. It is now providing basic goods to the neighbourhood. With a loan of US$800, Tatuka wants to provide much better services to people and buy a large stock of soap, sugar, salt, milk, spices and storage cans. Tatuka’s shop is very useful for her community which is isolated from downtown. Her other plans include expanding her business by adding cement and beverages in order to serve the community.

loans.use: To add to the stock of her goods and to diversify her business by adding sacs of cement

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Mr. L. is married with three children. His first son is in college. Mr L. first came to PEMCI with a request of a $429 loan to enable him purchase a new power saw for his business. He successfully repaid the loan and requested a 2nd loan of $714 to stock up his business with raw timber. Kiva funded the second loan which he has been able to clear from the bulk sale of his remaining timber stocks.

He has now requested a loan of US$1200 which will enable him to expand his furniture making business. So far PEMCI has had a very successful relationship with Mr L. and we are proud to be associated with his business growth. He is a determined businessman and is well respected in the community for his honesty and hard work. He is a role model for other upcoming businesses and we need more like him. Through his activities he is able to employ a number of workers and to mentor younger people entering the furniture business. Mr L. is worth the support of Kiva partners in his contribution to alleviating poverty and unemployment in this part of the country.

loans.use: To expand his furniture making business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married with three young children in primary school. He has no formal training, having left school at an early age because his family could not pay the fees. He comes from a humble peasant family from the central part of Kenya. He started a small business selling new clothes at the border (Malaba) and has been able to slowly grow. He received his first loan from PEMCI to expand his retail shop and he successfully repaid the loan.

With this second loan he plans to expand his shop into both a retail and wholesale outlet. He also intends to diversify by offering cosmetic products.
