She started working as a businesswoman in 1999 in order to support her family in meeting their basic needs. As a fishmonger, she trades from market to market within her locality.

With this loan of $200 from PEMCI, she will increase her stock, which would cut down on the number of trips she has to make each week to the buying centers. This would lower her transportation cost and improve her profit margins.

To supplement her income further, Eroo also works as a local massage lady, mainly treating those suffering from bone-related illnesses. This enables her to play a very important role in her community as a healer. Eroo is well-worth the support from Kiva.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nyamizi

texts.en:
Nyamizi is married with four children. She lives at Mtakuja in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam. She sells right beside her residence. She has been in this business for over six years.

Luckily enough she lives near the industrial area. Her major customers are industrial workers. She has more customers than she can serve, particularly during lunch time. She has few chairs and tables, food serving dishes, food wrapping materials and a stock of food. She need to improve this situation before competitors seize her opportunity. She is in need of USD750

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mike Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a young married man with one nursery level child. He has formal training in mechanics and carpentry. He started his business in 2002 to meet his family's financial needs.

This is Jackson’s second loan with PEMCI and his first with Kiva. The first loan of $150 was used to grow his business and was repaid in a timely manner. With this loan, he was able to open a yard for selling firewood to the local community. Firewood constitutes the main form of cooking fuel and is becoming scarce due to deforestation. Hence, Jackson is providing a vital service to his local community to meet their fuel needs.

With the experience and advantages derived from the first loan, Jackson has now requested another loan - this time of $450 - to boost his timber business further, and to enable him to buy timber and diversify into furniture-making. The business now employs two people who sell firewood in the local markets.

His success in business has made him a local role model for young people. To support his community, he teaches local youth skills in mechanics. This young man is truly worthy of our support, and we hope to find and encourage many more business people like him.

loans.use: To expand his timber & firewood selling business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is married with children, and all are in primary school. She is a primary school dropout. She started her business in 2002 and has not undertaken any training. She is an optimistic lady who inspires local women in her community’s self-help group dealing with poverty eradication projects.

Rosemary completed her first loan successfully. The fish she sells compliment other foods with protein in the local community area. She has been in the business for over six years and has gained enough experience. With the help of a second loan of $150 through Kiva, she intends to increase her stock so she can sell both retail and as a supplier to other fishmongers.

loans.use: Buy fish stocks

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a young married man with two children. He is a trained mechanic from San’galo Institute of Science and Technology. He was working in a local garage in his area but quit in 2005 and started his business of selling new clothes.

With the support of the $150 loan through PEMCI, he plans to increase the stock of his business. He is continuously garnering experience in the business and inspiring the youth in the area to go into business as a way of breaking out of the poverty trap. Samson is worth supporting.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is married and has four children who are all in secondary school. She is a secondary school dropout and has not undertaken any formal training. She started her business in 1998 in order to support her family and to supplement her husband's income. He is a civil servant.

With the loan of $150 from PEMCI, Violet plans to restock her little shop in order to increase her earnings. With this business, she has been able to assist her husband in supporting her family and their needs, especially in meeting the cost of schooling their young children. Secondary education in Kenya is very expensive; for ordinary simple folks like these, the cost can be a big strain on the family income. Violet is therefore doing the right thing in supplementing her husband's salary. She is well-worth our support.

loans.use: To stock her shop

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Marta teaches crafts and one of her main objectives is to promote art and crafts among young people, children, and adults. This occupation is also her only source of income, since she makes handicrafts and sells them. The main materials she uses are seeds, flowers, glue, carpentry, and piñatas. She is now requesting a loan of $475 with which she plans to buy the materials she needs to continue giving her art workshops.

Marta’s goal is to be able to continue working as a teacher and cultural promoter. It is very important to her to plant the love of art in her students, so that they can develop their abilities and get out of bad habits and delinquency. You can help her school continue. Your support is very useful for Martha and each one of her students.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta es maestra de manualidades, uno de sus principales objetivos es promover el arte y las manualidades en los jóvenes, niños y adultos. Este oficio también representa para ella su única fuente de ingresos, ya que se dedica a hacer manualidades y venderlas. Los principales materiales que utiliza son semilla, flores, resina, carpintería y piñatas. Ahora ella solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares con los que planea comprar los materiales que necesita para seguir impartiendo sus talleres de arte.

La meta de Marta es poder seguir ejerciendo como maestra y promotora cultural, para ella es muy importante sembrar el arte en sus alumnos, que ellos puedan desarrollar sus habilidades y se retiren de los vicios y la delincuencia. Tú puedes ayudar a que esta escuela continúe, tu apoyo es de mucha utilidad para Martha y para cada uno de sus alumnos.

loans.use: To buy craft materials

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Verónica has been selling used clothing for seven years. At first her mother helped her, but she became ill and Verónica continued on her own with the business. The income from this job has been very necessary for her because her husband drives a public transport bus and the money he receives is not sufficient to provide for their seven children. The youngest are 3 and 8 years old and their oldest children help with selling the clothing. Now Verónica requires a loan of $200, which she will use to buy more clothing in order offer more variety to her clients. In this way she will increase her sales.

It has not been easy for Verónica and her family to overcome all the obstacles, but by being a strong family they have been able to conquer all adversity. They also need your help. Your generosity is a great support for them—have no doubts, they appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Verónica tiene siete años comercializando ropa usada, inicialmente su mamá le ayudaba pero después se enfermó y verónica se quedó sola con el negocio, y para ella ha sido muy necesario el ingreso que recibe por este trabajo, porque su esposo es chofer de trasporte urbano y el dinero que recibe es insuficiente para poder sustentar a sus siete hijos, los más pequeños son de 3 y 8 años de edad y sus hijos más grandes le ayudan en la venta. Ahora Verónica requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de más mercancía para poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas.

No ha sido fácil para Verónica y su familia poder vencer todos los obstáculos, pero con la unión de la familia ha podido superar todas las adversidades. También necesitan de tu ayuda, tu generosidad es de gran apoyo para ellos, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecen

loans.use: To buy inventory of clothing

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Doña Antonia is from San Luis Potosí. She has four children, aged 13, 15, 23, and 25. She began selling jewelry and shoes from catalogs five years ago. The income she earns has allowed Antonia to offer her children education and sustenance. Right now she is going through some difficult times and doesn’t have the money to cover her orders. For this reason she needs a loan of $200, which she will use to provide better service to her clients. She expects to return the money over a period of 3 to 6 months.

Antonia and her family need your friendliness and collaboration. You can contribute to improving their quality of life. This family’s future is in your hands, decide to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

San Luis Potosí es de donde es originaria Doña Antonia tiene cuatro hijos de 13, 15, 23 y 25 años y desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de joyería y calzado por catálogo, el ingreso que obtiene le ha permitido a Antonia ofrecerle a sus hijos educación y sustento. Actualmente pasa por momentos difíciles y no cuenta con dinero suficiente para cubrir sus pedidos, por esta razón requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizará para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella espera devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses.

La señora Antonia y su familia necesitan de tu cariño y colaboración, tú puedes contribuir a mejorar su calidad de vida, en tus manos está el futuro de esta familia, decídete a ayudarlos.

loans.use: To buy products for resale

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.en:
Maria is married and has a 6 year-old son. Her husband, José, is a mason and with the salary he receives it is not possible to support their family. This is why María decided to work, and for two years she has been working in shoe sales. This job has been very useful to her and her family because it has allowed her to pay her son’s school fees and offer him a good education. The demand for the shoes that María sells has increased and she has many orders that she hasn’t been able to fill. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $200. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Today you can help someone who is in need—María and her family appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad. Su esposo José es albañil y con el salario que recibe no es posible sustentar a su familia, por lo que María decidió trabajar y desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de calzado, para ella y su familia ha sido de gran utilidad este oficio, pues le ha permitido pagar las colegiaturas de su hijo y ofrecerle una buena educación a su hijo. La demanda por el calzado que ofrece María se ha incrementado y tiene muchos pedidos que no ha podido surtir, por lo que ella solicita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, María y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a widow and has four married children. When she became a widow, Lorenza saw the necessity of earning an income in some way and this is why she began to sell cosmetics. This is her only source of income because her children do not help her with her expenses. Lorenza has has several orders that she hasn’t been able to fill, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $375, which she will use to fill the orders. She believes she can return the loan over a period of 5 to 10 months.

Lorenza knows there are people who help those in need. You can help her, she needs your generosity and support. She thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lorenza es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos que están casados, después de enviudar, doña Lorenza se vio en la necesidad de obtener ingresos de alguna manera y así comenzó a vender cosméticos, para ella este es su único sustento porque sus hijos no le ayudan con sus gastos. Doña Lorenza tiene varios pedidos que no ha podido surtir, por lo que solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizará con este fin, ella confía en devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses.

Doña Lorenza sabe que hay personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ayudarle, ahora necesita de tu generosidad y apoyo, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Erika Denice

texts.en:
Erika is from Tamaulipas, she is married and has one child, who is one year old. Her husband, Rudy, works in a printing shop and with his salary it’s not possible to satisfy all the needs of his family. It was for this reason that two years ago Erika was helping a neighbor make steamed tacos. The idea of getting ahead inspired Erika to get a cart to sell the tacos in front of a school. At first he bought the food from her neighbor, but now she wants to make it herself.

Erika needs a loan of $325 to repair the cart from which she sells her products and to make it look nicer. She will also use the money to buy ingredients she needs to make the steamed tacos. Become an important part of Erika’s dreams—you can help her grow into a successful woman, she is depending on you.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika es originaria de Tamaulipas, es casada y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad. Su esposo Rudy trabaja en una imprenta, y con su salario no es posible satisfacer todas las necesidades de su familia, por este motivo desde hace dos años Erika trabajaba ayudándole a una vecina a la elaboración de tacos de vapor. La ilusión de superarse hicieron que Erika consiguiera un carrito para vender los tacos en la salida de una escuela, inicialmente ella le compraba los alimentos a su vecina, pero ahora quiere elaborarlos ella misma.

Ahora Erika necesita de un préstamo de $ 325 dólares para reparar el vehiculo en el que vende sus productos y darle una mejor imagen, así como para la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de los tacos a vapor. Conviértete en parte importante en los sueños de Erika, tú puedes ayudarle a crecer y ser una mujer exitosa, depende de ti.

loans.use: To repair her cart and to buy ingredients

loans.name: Maria Paula Martina

texts.en:
Maria Paula has been in sales for 23 years. It was her inability to provide for her basic necessities that motivated her to work as a street vendor. After much work and dedication, she was able to rent a shop space in the market in Mérida and that is how she was able to have her own business. She has a 20 year-old son and this business has allowed Maria to support her family all this time. They have been difficult times, but with love and the strength of her family they have been able to conquer all adversities.

Maria requires a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to buy inventory for her store in order to offer better variety and increase her sales. You can be part of the growth of this business. Have no doubt, you can help someone in need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 23 años la señora Maria Paula se dedica a las ventas, la falta de recursos para satisfacer sus necesidades fue lo que la impulsó a trabajar como vendedora ambulante, después, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, le fue posible rentar un local en el mercado de Mérida y así es como logró tener su propio negocio. Ella tiene un hijo de 20 años y este negocio le ha permitido a Maria sustentar a su familia todo este tiempo. Han sido tiempos difíciles, pero el amor y la unión de la familia han podido vencer todas las adversidades.

Ahora Maria requiere un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para su local, para ofrecer una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ser parte del crecimiento de este negocio, puedes ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo dudes.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita began selling fried foods and fruits when she was very young. She is a very hardworking woman with an enormous desire to get ahead. When she didn’t have what she needed to get by, she decided to begin her business and help out with the family expenses. Margarita has two children who are 10 and 14 years old and she wants to help them continue studying. She needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to buy inventory in order to increase her sales.

You can be a part of the growth of this business. You can make possible a better life for Margarita and her family. Your generosity and warmth will be a great help to this family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Margarita empezó desde muy joven con la venta de fritangas y frutas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y con enormes deseos de salir adelante, al no contar con los recursos necesarios ella decidió emprender su negocio y colaborar con el gasto familiar, Margarita tiene dos hijas, de 10 y 14 años de edad, y quiere ayudarlas a que continúen estudiando. Ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas y su utilidad.

Tú puedes formar parte del crecimiento de este negocio, puedes hacer posible una mejor vida para Margarita y su familia, tu generosidad y cariño será de gran ayuda para esta familia.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Miss Thu and her husband have 4 children who are 9, 8, 7 and 2. They don’t have a house of their own so they live at her husband’s parents' in a small hut. They don’t have any land.

Miss Thu’s husband, Quang, is a day laborer. He can’t easily find business. Miss Thu sells fruits in a small market in the village. Their family income is very low at $7/person/month. Miss Thu wants to borrow $50 to increase her sales.

loans.use: Sell fruits

loans.name: Georgia

texts.en:
Georgia has been taking sandal-making courses for over 6 months with our organization. She has been one of the most outstanding students of the course, as she has been very dedicated to learning and improving her skills. She started her sandal-making business after three months in the course. Her daughters helped her out with some start-up capital so she could buy supplies and get her business going. She will use the loan to invest in more materials for sandal-making and also to buy a glass display case where she can offer her products to the public.

Georgia has been living in Guayaquil for about 11 years after leaving her home town of Esmeraldas. She left because she wanted to provide her children with better education and opportunities. Currently, one of her daughters is in college and the others are finishing their high school studies.

loans.use: Purchase materials and a display case

loans.name: Manola

texts.en: Manola V. lives in the village of Boliartzi, near Asenovgrad. She has had her own business since 1995. Manola keeps a small hardware store in the village. She tills about 7 hectares of her own land and also breeds 12 cows and 5 calves in an own cowshed. Next to her cowshed she has opened a milk station where she buys milk from other farmers. Because of the enlargement of capacity of her milk station Manola V. needs a new pan for collecting milk. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To buy a new pan for collecting milk

loans.name: Bairam

texts.en: Bairam S. is 29 years old. He is single and lives in the village of Muldava, near Asenovgrad. Bairam has had a farming business since 2000. Then he has bought a cowshed from the previous state agricultural company in Asenovgrad and started breeding cows. Now 6 years later he has 23 cows in his farm. Because the cowshed is old and needs repairs Bairam S. applies for a $1200 loan. He will refit the cowshed roof and will build some partition walls to separate his cows.

loans.use: To refit the cowshed roof and build some partition walls

loans.name: Ivailo

texts.en: Ivailo G. is 25 years old. He is single and lives in Blagoevgrad. He graduated from a construction school. After graduation he started a small construction business five years ago. Ivailo makes internal repairs – plastering, flooring and painting.  Ivailo has two employees. Now Ivailo G. applies for this $ 1200 loan to buy some construction equipment for his business.

loans.use: To buy some construction equipment

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 35, her husband, Nhan, is 39. Be lives with 2 children, aged 3 and 10. The elder is at primary school. Be also looks after her parents-in-law, who are in their seventies.

Be has a small grocery store at her home and her husband is a farmer: he takes care of the vegetable garden which is 2500 square meters. Both the grocery store and the garden are their main income, which comes to only $5 person/month. It is thus difficult for them to pay for food and the parents' medicine, plus the child's school fees.

They hope to receive a loan of $75 from Kiva so that they can increase the kind of goods for the shop and purchase some fertilizer and seeds for the garden. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To increase the kind of goods for the grocery store and purchase some fertilizer, seeds for the garden

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Madame Phuong and her husband have 4 children, but they also support her brother-in-law who is constantly sick and cannot work. Phuong has cardiac problems and a goiter. She spends $20 every month on medicines alone.

They have 4000 m2 of land where they plant cassava. They also have 3000 m2 of rice paddy. Selling vegetables is thus important for them as additional income: about $1/day profit.

Phuong is a member of a credit group and has already borrowed twice, repaying every week $1-$2 for 45 weeks. This time she asks to borrow $75 to expand her small business.

loans.use: Selling vegetables

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda has a small cafe where she sells lunches. She started out by working as a cook in a cafe, but her earnings were not sufficient, so Glenda started her own business with the help of some money given to her by the godfather of one of her children. Now she has a solid clientele and is very well-known in the area for her good cooking.

Glenda will use this loan to invest in the purchase of bigger pots, an industrial stove, and benches for her business. She knows that with this investment her sales will increase. In this way she will be able to earn more and provide a better education for her children.

Glenda is 37 years old, she is single and she has 3 children. She depends completely on this business to support her family. The father of her children abandoned her when the youngest daughter was just three years old. She is very concerned about the education of her children. She is an enterprising woman and she knows that her business will grow and will provide the financial security she needs.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Glenda tiene un pequeño comedor donde ella vende almuerzos. Ella comenzó trabajando como cocinera en un comedor pero lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba en su economia. Glenda empezo su negocio con la ayuda de un dinero que le dio el padrino de uno de sus hijos. Ahora ella tiene clientela fija y es muy conocida en el sector por su sazón.

Glenda usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ollas mas grandes, una cocina industrial y bancos para su negocio. Ella sabe que con esta inversión sus ventas crecerán. Asi podra tener más ganancia en su negocio que le permita darle una mejor educacion para sus hijos.

Glenda tiene 37años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Ella depende totalmente de su negocio para ayudar a su familia. El padre de los niños la abandono cuando su hija menor apenas tenia tres años.Ella se preocupa por la educacion de sus hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora y sabe que su negocio crecerá y le dará la seguridad financiera que necesita.

loans.use: Glenda will use the loan to invest in the purchase of bigger pots, an industrial stove, and benches for her business.

loans.name: Darwing

texts.en:
Darwing works making and selling "encebollados" (a local dish made with onions). Darwing arrived in Guayaquil five years ago, coming from Milagro where where he did agricultural work. He started out with the help of his cousin, who taught him the business. He makes the encebollados and sells them on the corner in his neighborhood.

Darwing will use this loan to invest in the purchase of tables, benches, and pots that he needs. He is convinced that his sales will increase and improve his quality of life.

Darwing is 30 years old, he is married and his wife helps him in the business. He has one child, 2 years old. He hopes with his earnings to save enough money to expand the business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Darwing se dedica a la elaboración y venta de encebollados. Darwing llego a Guayaquil hace 5 años proveniente de Milagro donde se desempeña en labores agrícola. Empezo con la ayuda de su cuñado que le enseño el negocio.El elabora los encebollados y los vende en la esquina de su barrio.

Darwing usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mesas, bancos y ollas que necesita. El esta convencido que sus ventas crecerán y mejorara su condición de vida.

Darwin tiene 30 años, es casado y su esposa le ayuda con su negocio. Tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edades espera con las ganancias ahorrar para crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Darwing will use the loan to invest in the purchase of tables, benches, and pots that he needs.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando has a small store wher he sells groceries and makes and sells bread. He started out with a small amount of savings from the salary he earned working at a shop. He learned how to make bread from the previous renter who had this business in this same location. With time and given the demand, he began to sell groceries, drinks, and various other articles.

Armando needs this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his business, because demand will soon be increasing, when school classes begin. He is sure that with this investment he will obtain good earnings, which will enable him to provide economic security for his family.

Armando is married and 34 years old. He has 3 children who are in school. His wife helps him with the business, and they depend on it to support the family. Armando hopes that with this investment he will earn more and can give economic security to the family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Armando tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende víveres y elabora y vende pan. El empezo con un pequeño capital producto de ahorros del salario de una empresa donde trabajaba. El aprendió la elaboración del pan de un inquilino que tenia ese negocio antes en el mismo local. Con el tiempo y dada la demanda comenzó a vender víveres, colas y artículos de bazar.

Armando necesita el préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería para su negocio dado a que pronto se inician las clases y la demanda crece. El esta seguro que con esta inversión obtendrá buenas ganancias que le permitirá tener una seguridad económica para su familia.

Armando esta casado y tiene 34 años. Tiene 3 hijos que estudian. Su esposa le ayuda con el negocio y depende del mismo para apoyar a su familia. Armando espera con esta inversión obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan darle una seguridad económica a su familia.

loans.use: Armando needs this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eladio needs to invest in the purchase of notebooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has a business making and selling fashion accessories. She also sells household items and bottled water. Nancy started out two years ago selling plastic items for the kitchen, with the help of a little bit of money given to her by her husband. Over time she also learned how to make bracelets, necklaces, and other items she now sells.

Nancy needs this loan to invest in the raw materials for the manufacture of her products, and to buy more supplies for selling water. She is sure that her sales will increase and she will be able to provide a better education for her children.

Nancy is 41 years old and she has two children who are in school. She helps support the household with the income from her business. Along with the salary earned by her husband, she is able to keep up with the household expenses. She is sure that with this investment she will be able to earn more and help with a better education for her children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Nancy tiene el negocio de elaboración de bisutería y venta de artículos para el hogar. Nancy empezo con un pequeño capital que le proporciono su esposo con el comercio de artículos para el hogar hace 2 años, vendiendo la línea de artículos plásticos para la cocina.Con el tiempo fue aprendiendo la elaboración de pulsera, collares y otros que ella los comercia. Ella también vende agua en botellones.

Nancy necesita el préstamo para invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos y comprar mas pomas para vender agua. Ella esta segura que sus ventas crecerá y le podra dar una mejor educacion a sus hijos.

Nancy tiene 41 años y tiene dos niños que estudian. Ella ayuda en el hogar con las ganancias de su negocio. Junta con el sueldo que gana su esposo para poder afrontar con la economía del hogar tiene la seguridad que con la inversión que hará le permitirá tener mejores ganancias y poder ayudar con una mejor educacion para sus hijos.

loans.use: Nancy needs this loan to invest in raw materials for her crafts.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has a small grocery shop in her home. She started her business with the help of her sister, who has a supplier in the market and helped her get started in the business. She started out selling vegetables and groceries. Now, in addition to those products, she also sells office supplies.

Sonia will use this loan to invest in wholesale merchandise, and in that way increase her income. She is confident that with those new products her business will grow.

Sonia is separated from her husband and is the mother of three children. She is 43 years old. Sonia hopes that with this loan she will improve the quality of life for her family and that it will help her continue to grow her business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Sonia tiene una tienda en su domicilio. Sonia empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana que tiene un puesto de abastos en el mercado facilitándole la mercadería para que empiece su negocio. Se inicio vendiendo legumbres y víveres. Ahora ella continúa vendiendo estos productos junto con artículos varios de oficina.

Sonia usara el préstamo para invertir en mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la confianza que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá.

Sonia es separada y madre de tres hijos, tiene 43 años. Sonia tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Sonia will use this loan to invest in wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.en:
Jesús works selling cosmetics and clothing to his neighborhood and the surrounding areas. Jesús started this business with the help of a friend who helped her get started by providing merchandise. At the beginning, she only sold cosmetics. Now she also offers clothing and shoes, and in the future she aspires to sell home electronics also.

She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of mixers and rice cookers, which are the products her customers have asked for. Jesús is convinced that with this new merchandise, her business will grow.

Jesús is married and has three children, all in school. She is 36 years old, and she depends on her business to support her family and continue providing an education for her children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Jesús se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa en su sector y recorriendo provincias. Jesús empezó su negocio con la ayuda de una amiga que le facilito mercadería para que emprendiera su propio negocio. Al principio solo vendía cosméticos ahora ofrece este producto junto con ropa y zapatos. Jesús aspira vender artículos varios y electrodomésticos.

Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de batidoras y ollas arroceras que son productos que le están solicitando sus clientes. Jesús esta convencida que con su nueva mercadería su negocio va tener crecimiento.

Jesús esta casada tiene tres hijos todos estudian. Ella tiene 36 años, depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia y seguirle dando la educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of mixers and rice cookers.

loans.name: Holger

texts.en:
Holger has a small shop where he offers food staples. He started this business with the help of his wife, who had been helping her parents with their business for ten years. At first they only sold sweets and home cleaning products. Now they also sell groceries and sausages.

Holger aspires to sell baby products and office supplies. He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices. He has faith that with these new products his business will grow and his economic stability will improve.

Holger is married and he has two children. He is 36 years old. He is originally from Manabí, and he moved to Guayaquil to find a better life for his family. He depends entirely on this business for the education and support of his children. Holger is sure that this loan will give him security and will allow him to save for the future.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Holger tiene una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa quien había ayudado a sus padres en un negocio en el mercado trabajando con ellos diez años. Al principio solo vendía confitería y productos de limpieza para el hogar. Ahora continua vendiendo este producto junto con víveres y embutidos.

Holger aspira vender producto para bebes y artículos de oficina. El usara el préstamo para invertir en compra de artículos de bazar a precios de mayoristas.El tiene la fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá y su estabilidad económica mejorara.

Holger esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Tiene 36 años es oriundo de Manabí se mudo a Guayaquil para encontrar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. El depende de su negocio completamente para la educación y sustento de sus hijos. Holger esta seguro que este préstamo le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Holger aspira vender  producto para bebes y artículos de oficina

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana works selling home electronics and plastics in the provinces. She started her business with the help of her spouse, who provided $200. At the beginning she only sold basins, buckets, and small utensils for everyday use. Now she also offers clothing, shoes, and wallets.

Roxana will use the loan to invest in sheets, curtains, and children's school shoes. She has faith that with these new products her business will grow.

Roxana is married and 21 years old. She depends on her business to get by, along with her husband. Roxana hopes that this loan will permit her to save toward the construction of a home.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer.)

Roxana se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y plásticos en provincias. Ella empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito 200 dólares. Al principio solo vendía lavacaras, baldes y pequeños utensilios de uso diario. Ahora continúa ofreciendo este producto junto con ropa, zapatos y carteras.

Roxana usara el préstamo para invertir en sabanas y toldos y zapatos escolares .Ella tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio va a crecer.

Roxana esta casada tiene 21 años. Ella depende de su negocio para seguir adelante junto con su esposo. Roxana tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para construir su vivienda.

loans.use: Roxana will use the loan to invest in sheets, curtains, and children's school shoes.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela has a small shop in her home where she sells school supplies and various articles. Manuela started her business with money that she had saved through giving in-home massages, manicures, and pedicures. At first she only sold paper items and notebooks. Now she also sells various other items.

Manuela aspires to sell office supplies and to buy a photocopy machine. She is convinced that, with this new service of photocopying, her sales will increase.

Manuela has two children, she is married and 34 years old. She has faith that, with this loan, her business will grow and her income will improve.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer.)

Manuela tiene una tienda en su vivienda donde vende útiles escolares y artículos varios. Manuela empezó su negocio con un dinero que tenia ahorrado ya que se dedica también a dar masajes y realizar manicure y pedicure a domicilio. Al principio solo vendía papelería y cuadernos. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos con artículos varios.

Manuela aspira vender suministro de oficina y comprar una maquina fotocopiadora. Ella esta convencida que con este nuevo servicio de copiadora su negocio mejorara sus ventas.

Manuela tiene dos hijos esta casada tiene 34 años. Manuela tiene la fe que con este préstamo su negocio se incrementara y sus ingresos mejoraran.

loans.use: Manuela aspires to sell office supplies and to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela works selling plastic items for the home. Rafaela started her business with the support of her spouse, who gave her the money to buy a booth in the outdoor market. At first, she only sold basins, buckets, and chairs. Now she also sells small home electronics and clothing.

Rafaela aspires to sell microwave ovens and dishware. She will use this loan to invest in home electronics and plastic items. She has faith tha twith these new products, her business will grow and permit her to continue investing in merchandise.

Rafaela is married, and she has one daughter, who is grown. She is convinced that her business will see growth.

(Tranlsated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rafaela se dedica a la venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar. Rafaela empezo su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo quie le facilito el dinero para la compra de un modulo en el mercado.Al principio solo vendia lavacaras , baldes y sillas. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos juntos pequeños electrodomesticos y ropa.

Rafaela aspira vender microondas y vajillas .Ella usara el prestamo para invertir en electrodomesticos y articulos plasticos .Ella tiene FE que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecera y le permitira seguir invirtiendo en mercaderia.

Rafaela esta casada tiene una hija que es independiente .Esta convencida que su negocio tendrá un crecimiento.

loans.use: She will use this loan to invest in home electronics and plastic items.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema makes and sells batik clothes. She attended a training in batik-making and tailoring from Small Industries Development Organisation (SIDO) in Dar es Salaam. She has been doing well in this business for years now. Besides covering her high operating costs, she managed to earn a small profit which keeps her livelihood.

Most of her customers buy on credit. This situation makes her business grow slowly. She has to collect her debts before she makes another batik. She lacks enough working capital to run her business efficiently. She needs USD550 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada She is married with a child. She lives in Dar es Salaam City, Tanzania. She is a qualified nurse at Muhimbili College of Health Sciences. She has a pharmacy for the care of people in her community. Her business is licensed by the authorities.

She wants to add a stock of drugs especially for malaria and amoebic dysentery. These diseases are very common to people of her area. She needs a loan of USD550. She hopes to use the loan for business improvement.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Salum

texts.en:
Salum operates a metal scraper business. The main materials he deals with are aluminium and iron scrapers. He collects these used metals from his suppliers in different streets. His suppliers collect scrapers for these metals, clean and store them in established stores.

Salum, on a weekly basis, hires a car and goes to his suppliers' stores and collects the scraper materials. He sells these scrapers to industries that recycle these metals.

Business was not good for the past six months due to electricity problem facing the country, but recently the power supply has returned to normal. More scrapers are needed by the industries. Salum needs a working capital to buy more scrapers from his suppliers. He needs USD1000 to strengthen his working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa lives in Mtambani area in the Ilala District of Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child. Sharifa runs a tailoring business at her home.

The business has not been good recently due to insufficient sewing materials. She wants to improve her business by having enough supply sewing materials and a rented business premise. She is currently working on the varandah of her house which does not attract customers and does not provide her enough space. She also needs to add two sewing machines and one assistant. The strategy requires a capital boost of USD550.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married with two children. She lives in Dar es Salaam in the place called Lumo. Her parents could not afford her further education costs. After being married Sharifa could not stand being only a housewife. She started a cloth selling shop with the aim of generating income for the family, as her husband’s income was not sufficient to cover all the family requirements.

It is now eight years since she started this business. She has experienced minimal improvements for all that period, due to competition she faces from nearby shops selling clothes. Sharifa has discovered unique competencies, usage of which can outperform her competitors. One is to have enough stock of frequently purchased clothes and ordering new fashionable clothes which competitors cannot order. These strategies need additional funding. Sharifa is in need of USD750 to implement her plans.

loans.use: Increase stock of clothes

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is an enthusiastic type of person, who usually tries her best to achieve more and more. After finishing secondary school she joined womens' empowerment organizations. Being an active member of these organizations she attended various courses offered, like food production, batik-making and tailoring.

Currently Sophia prepares various snacks for sale. She sells cakes, samosas,beef sausages, vitumbua, chapattis, burns and the like. Her regular customers are restaurants, food vendors and school canteens.

Recently she realized an opportunity of preparing food for community ceremonies like weddings, graduations, baptisms, farewells and the like. This line of business needs an investment of capital. She has to buy food serving dishes, food wrapping materials, cooking equipment and stocks of food. A loan of USD1000 will help her implement this business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old, she is married, and has four children, one son whom they adopted. Josephine is married to a pastor, so apart from her tailoring work, she also works part time to assist her husband with church work. Apart from her children who are now grown up and in various colleges, Josephine also has two dependent children that she supports through paying their school fees back at home. Being the wife of a pastor also requires her to offer support to the members of their church and she therefore also supports two single mothers and one widow who is also her employee.

Josephine started her dress-making business in order to sustain her family in 1992, after she received a loan of Ksh7,000 (USD100) from a local NGO. This loan was to be shared amongst three people and was meant to be used to start a business. The three started a small business in partnership, but within a short time, the other two partners requested that Josephine take over the loan repayment, and to employ and pay them on commission. Josephine later attended a two-year course training in embroidery, tie-dye and fashion design. With the new skills learned, Josephine began to make bridal wear, African attire and even began to make curtains.

Since then, her business has expanded from a small stall which three people shared, to the four stalls that she now owns in the Jericho market, one of the market areas in Nairobi. Josephine now seeks additional support in the form of a loan to enable her to buy bridal wear materials in bulk. For this, she seeks a loan of USD725 repayable within 6 – 12 months. Purchase of these materials will enable her to cut the cost of the materials that she buys in small bits. This will also enable her to give reasonable prices to her customers, and will at the same time ensure that she gets higher income. This will improve the situation at her business, and will help her to continue to maintain her staff.

loans.use: To purchase bulk materials for making wedding gowns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Wanjuhi Wainaina intends to purchase five pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi Wanjiku intends to purchase a dairy cow and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pauline Ngaruiya intends to pay school fees for her secondary-school-age child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta Wanjiru Njoroge intends to buy high quality seeds and fertilizers in preparation for the coming rainy season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy maize and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is a widowed mother of three children. After the death of her husband, Lesya had to find ways to provide for herself and her three kids. For fifteen years she has had a small business selling knitted wear for children. It has now become the main source of income for her family. Lesya is a cheerful, hard-worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid two loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” which have helped create stability for her business. Currently, Lesya has about $1,600 of working capital. Her monthly gross revenue amounts to $800. Lesya is requesting a loan for $700 to re-supply her inventory before the spring season. She is planning to purchase 20 jackets, 20 sweaters and 70 clothing sets for different age groups of children. One of her long-term goals is to rent a second vending facility. In pursuit of her goal, Lesya plans to invest her extra profits into the expansion of her business.

Леся – вдова, в неї троє дітей. Після смерті чоловіка Леся була змушена шукати можливостей забезпечити себе та дітей. На протязі останніх 15 років вона займається бізнесом з продажу дитячого трикотажу. Зараз це – головне джерело прибутку для її родини. Леся – дуже жвава й працьовита всупереч усім труднощам, з якими їй довелося стикнутися. Вона сплатила дві позики, які отримала від „Надії України”, вони допомогли стабілізувати її бізнес. Зараз в Лесі приблизно 1600 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний дохід складає 800 доларів. Леся просить про позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів напередодні весняного сезону. Вона планує придбати 20 курток, 20 светрів та 70 дитячих комплектів одягу для різних вікових груп. В майбутньому Леся планує орендувати ще одне торгове приміщення. Для досягнення цієї мети вона планує інвестувати отриманий прибуток в подальший розвиток власного бізнесу.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married and has a little son. He graduated from art school and eight years ago started a small business manufacturing furniture. He has built up about $1,600 in working capital. His monthly net profit amounts to $1,000. Vladimir is a very determined hard-worker. His goal is to manufacture the best possible furniture at the best prices providing the best value to his customers. He recently moved his shop to a new location where he makes a range of products including dining room tables, coffee tables, book shelves, dressers and mirrors. Different furniture units available in a variety of colors and designs provide many options for each individual taste. The competitive prices, affordable design and unique style of his durable, hand-made furniture attract many customers to his shop. Vladimir is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase some necessary tools and wood materials for his workshop. He is hopeful that with his hard work, determination, and financial assistance his business will continue to be successful and provide himself and his family with stable, long term income.

Володимир – одружений, в нього є маленький син. Він закінчив вище художнє училище. Вісім років тому він почав власний бізнес з виготовлення меблів. У Володимира зараз приблизно 1600 доларів робочого капіталу. Його щомісячний чистий прибуток складає 1000 доларів. Володимир – дуже наполегливий та працьовитий. Він завжди прагне виготовляти лише найкращі меблі за вигідними цінами поєднуючи це з чудовим обслуговуванням. Зовсім нещодавно майстерня Володимира перемістилася в інше місце. Зараз він виготовляє обідні столи, полички, комоди та дзеркала. Різноманітні кольори та дизайн меблів можуть задовольнити найвибагливіший смак. Помірні ціни, доступний дизайн та унікальний стиль якісних меблів ручної роботи приваблюють багато покупців до його майстерні. Володимир просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб придбати необхідні інструменти та дерев’яну сировину. Він сподівається, що наполеглива робота та цілеспрямованість у поєднанні з фінансовою допомогою сприятимуть подальшому успіху його бізнесу та забезпечать стабільний прибуток для його родини.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wholesale grocery stock

loans.name: Santos Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. H. is an enterprising person that just started a shipping and messenger business. He's created a work team, and he wants to employ at least 4 people. He says, "I decided to take on a great responsibility in this business and I don't want us to lack items essential to our work. So I am asking for a $1200 loan to buy a scale."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Hernández es una persona emprendedora acaba de iniciar un negocio de mensajería y paquetería y ha formado su equipo de trabajo, el desea brindar fuente de empleo a por lo menos 4 personas. "He decidido tomar una gran responsabilidad en este negocio por lo que no quiero que nos falte nada indispensable para desarrollar nuestras labores por esto les solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para la compra de una bascula.

loans.use: Buy a scale.

loans.name: Ma. Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hernandez sells clothes in the city markets. She buys new merchandise herself by making trips to the state of Guanajuato. A large part of her sales are orders that her clients place. She says, "I've been doing this for a long time, so I already have my client list and I can easily sell them most of my merchandise. The rest of what I buy I sell in the market. At the moment, I don't have summer items, and I would like to buy a supply. I am asking for a loan of $1200."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. H. vende en los tianguis de la ciudad, ella misma compra la ropa nueva mediante viajes que realiza al estado de Guanajuato, gran parte de sus compras son encargos que le realizan sus clientes. "Llevo ya mucho tiempo haciendo esto así que tengo ya mi lista de clientes y no batallo para acomodar la mayoría de mi mercancía, otra parte de lo que compro lo vendo en el tianguis, por el momento no tengo mercancía de verano y quisiera abastecerme, solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: To buy summer merchandise.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Hello. My name is Amparo and my main job is trade. Since there are few job opportunities in this city, I took the initiative to establish my own confectioner’s business, and I sell my products on the streets. I have been working at this type of job for several years, work which generates income to cover my family’s costs. Thanks to this business we have been able to provide for our children, most of which are professionals and are in university. Recently, demand has grown and I don’t have sufficient capital to satisfy my clients’ demands.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, lard, sugar, butter, eggs, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.en: My name is Manuel de Jesús, and I make and sell sweets and candy. My business is in my home, and I go to different markets to sell by products. Thanks to this business I have been able to provide for my family since my business generates income to cover my commitments to my suppliers and my family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, bags, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en: Hello, my name is Arcenia and I make and sell tortillas. I work in my home and I have been working at this job for several years. Thanks to my business, I can help cover my family expenses and pay for my children’s education. Demand for my product has grown, and I need to produce more, but I don’t have the capital necessary to do so.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood

loans.name: Amparo De Jesus

texts.en: My name is Amparo and for several years I have owned a grocery store in the center of the city. Thanks to my business I can help cover my family’s expenses and fulfill my commitments to my suppliers. With the income earned from this business I, as a single mother, have been able to provide an education for my children. Currently I need to stock my store in order to offer a variety of products to my clients.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, butter, spaghetti, soft drinks, flour, instant soups, etc.

loans.name: Heydi Jakeline

texts.en:
My name is Haydi Jakeline and I am a merchant, I have a store with clothes, shoes, lotions and other items, which I sell as a traveling saleswoman and also by commission. I have been working in this field for 2 years, which creates an income to cover family expenses and to take care of other obligations. Thanks to this business I can care for my family and tend to my customers, making enough income to improve our standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Haydi Jakeline, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa, calzado, lociones y otros los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, gracias a este negocio puedo anatender a mi familia y a mis clientes generando ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase women's wrist-watches,bracelets, rings, shoes, jeans, men's and women's shirts, lotion and other items.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Matha and I sell cosmetics for a living, which I distribute as a traveling saleswoman in the offices and schools in my city. I have several years experience in my business, which creates enough income to contribute to the family expenses and to take care of other obligations. Thanks to this business, the earnings in my household have improved and I was able to give my family a higher standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Hola mi nombre es Matha, mi actividad principal el la venta de Cosmeticos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en las Oficinas y Escuelas de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y demas compromisos, gracias a este negocio los ingresos en mi hogar han mejorado por lo que pudi ofrecer mejor nivel de vida mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, conditioners, face-creams, compact powder, lipstick, sun-screen, shades, eye-liners, and lip-liners.

loans.name: Mirian Saturnina

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Mirian and I am a dressmaker and my primary job is the creation of clothing items. I have a tailor shop and where I also sell accessories, located in the center of my city. I have several years experience in this business, which creates enough income to contribute to the family expenses and to take care of other obligations with my suppliers. At this moment in time, I need to stock my business in order to offer a greater variety of items to my clientel.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Hola mi Nombre es Mirian soy modista, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de prendas de vestir para damas, cuento con un negocio de confeccion y venta de accesorios ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con mis proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer a mi clientela variedad.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
For nearly 20 years, Svetlana has owned a small market business selling men’s clothing. Married with three children ages 28 to 24, she believes that God has blessed her business as she has sought to provide for the needs of her children and family. Svetlana currently has about 6000grh Ukrainian Hrivnas, in inventory which amounts to just under $1200 USD. Her take-home profit per month is usually around 1000grh or about $200 USD. She is known as a persistent, hard-working and goal oriented business owner. Through the years she has repaid a total of 11 different loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Generosity continues to be Svetlana’s motivation. Now that she has grandchildren coming along, there are more people that she would like to help. Svetlana has requested a loan for $500 to supplement her available capital and purchase inventory for the coming summer season. She wants to increase her business revenue so that she will have more income to share with her family.

На протязі 20 років Світлана займається бізнесом з продажу чоловічого одягу. Світлана – одружена, в неї троє дітей віком від 24 до 28 років. Вона вірить, що Господь благословив її бізнес й вона мала можливість забезпечувати потреби дітей та родини. Зараз у Світлани приблизно 1200 доларів в товарі. Щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 200 доларів. Світлана – наполеглива, працьовита та цілеспрямована. На протязі останніх років вона сплатила усі 11 позик, які отримала від „Надії України”. Світлана також дуже щедра. В неї нещодавно народились онуки, а, отже, допомога обов’язково знадобиться. Світлана просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів та закупити одяг для роздрібної торгівлі напередодні теплого літнього періоду. Вона хотіла б збільшити власні доходи для того, щоб забезпечити рідних усім необхідним.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda, whose name means hope in Russian, owns a successful perfume and cosmetics business located in a busy market in Nikopol. She has operated her business for six years. Lively and full of energy, she works hard to make her business a success. By offering a wide selection of products at affordable prices, she has been able to broaden her available customer base and meet the needs of more clients. Nadezhda is requesting a loan for $1200 to allow her to re-supply her inventory and introduce new product lines. Her long term goal is to expand her business by opening additional vending kiosks and hiring staff to help her with sales. Currently, she and her husband are in the process of remodeling their apartment. Nadezhda would like to use part of her business income to help pay for the remodeling and to buy some new appliances for their home.

Надія – власниця успішного бізнесу з продажу парфумів та косметики на ринку в Нікополі. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже шість років. Надія – дуже жвава та енергійна. Вона наполегливо працює, щоб досягти успіху. Завдяки широкому вибору товарів за доступними цінами, Надія змогла розширити коло клієнтів та задовольнити попит з боку покупців. Надія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів та закупити нові види парфумів й косметичних засобів. В майбутньому Надія хотіла б розширити бізнес, відкрити власну крамницю та взяти на роботу реалізаторів. Зараз вони з чоловіком роблять ремонт в квартирі. Надія планує витратити частину прибутку від бізнесу для того, щоб покрити витрати на ремонт приміщення та придбати нову побутову техніку для дому.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Anonymous
