loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosemary Wanjiku Munyua intends to buy animal feeds and other dairy supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy Wanjiru Mwangi intends to buy animal feeds and other dairy supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy Wanjiru Mwangi intends to develop her farm through purchase of organic manure and animal feeds for her dairy cows

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is married, has three children and also lives with her younger brother. She decided to live with him to enable him search for a job since this is not easy in the rural areas. She is 36 years of age and lives in Kayole, an informal settlement area of Nairobi. Lucy and her husband are living positively with HIV. Her husband is a soldier while she sells second-hand shoes at Gikomba market. This is an open-air second-hand clothes and accessories market.

In the year 2000, Lucy was given Ksh 10,000.00 (USD140) by her husband to enable her start the second-hand shoe business. She used the money to buy a bale of second-hand shoes and also to apply for a location to do her business, and was given a card that permits her to trade in that particular location. She previously used to sell with a friend for a period of one year and according to Lucy, this was a good exposure for her to master the skills required in the trade.

Lucy buys one bale of second-hand shoes and this can last her one week before she can buy another one, though sometimes the stock does not last as long and so she is left with nothing to sell. Unlike her friends who buy two or three bales that can keep their businesses in operation before another container of bales is dispatched, her business is affected and records minimal sales. By buying two bales, Lucy will not run out of stock for at least for two weeks before she can be sure to buy another bale, hence striving to maintain her customers. The increased stock will also enable her to supplement the household needs. Lucy is therefore requesting a loan of USD150 to enable her purchase stock for her business, which she intends to pay back within 6 – 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase stock for second-hand shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tarasila Wangui Irungu intends to buy the farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 3 sufurias (cooking pots), 2 plastic packing containers, & 1 jiko

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is 39 years old. She has divorced and now lives with 3 children. Her family is very poor. She has 1,000 square meters of rice land but the yield is low.

Her oldest child is 17 years old and has stopped school. She helps her mother to sell jackfruits in the market in order to help the two others to continue their school. The second child is 14 years old and the youngest child is 13 years old. It is difficult for her family to earn a living, so she wants to borrow US $75 to expand her small business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase and sell jackfruits.

loans.name: Nely Margarita

texts.en: Hello, my name is Nely and, for several years my primary activity has been clothing and American shoe sales. My business is located in the city center, and the income I receive is used to cover my family’s expenses and other commitments I have to my suppliers. Currently, I need to stock my store a little more since it is in a strategic location and the volume of sales is greater.

loans.use: Purchase of mixed clothing, children’s clothing, skirts, and American shoes.

loans.name: Blanca Ceferina

texts.en: Hello, my name is Blanca and I am a merchant. I have a used clothing store in my home in the center of my community. I have been doing this work for several years, and it has allowed me to provide my children with an education and cover my household expenses. My children now have an intermediate school degree and also work at the store.

loans.use: Purchase of mixed clothing, children’s clothing, skirts, nightgowns and pants.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: My name is Carmen, I’m a merchant and my primary activity is cosmetics and household cleaning products sales. I sell by catalogue and special order, and I deliver the products on foot. I have been doing this work for several years and I use my income to cover my family’s expenses and other commitments. My greatest wish is to be able to buy wholesale, so that I could earn more, increase my income and give my children a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of liquid soaps, body soaps, body creams, lip gloss, lotions.

loans.name: Marta Josefina

texts.en: My name is Marta, and my primary activity is the grocery store I operate in my house in the center of my community. I have been working at this type of job for several years, and it allows me to take care of my family and business. My children work with me during their free time. Thanks to this business I can help cover my family’s expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken, rice, sugar, butter, dairy products, meats, etc.

loans.name: Danubia Lizeth

texts.en: Hello, my name is Danubia, and my primary activity is commerce. I have fabric sales business, and I deliver all orders to my clients’ homes in my community. I have been working at this job for several years, and it generates income so that I can cover my family’s expense. I am a single mother, and my children depend on me. Recently, the volume of sales has increased, but I do not have the capital to meet the existing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of solid, printed, embroidered, and silk fabrics, as well as fabrics for pants.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.en: Hello, my name is Guadalupe. I am a merchant and my primary activity is lotion and jewelry sales. I distribute them as a street vendor, in different schools and offices. Thanks to this business I can help cover my family’s expenses and other commitments, and thus achieve greater opportunities and a better quality of life for my family.

loans.use: Purchase of chains, wristwatches, rings, earrings, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.en: Hello, my name is Reina and I am a merchant. I have a small new men’s and women’s clothing business located in the center of my community. I have been doing this work for several years, and with the income generated I can help cover my family’s expenses, especially since the economic situation is more and more difficult each day, and other incomes are necessary in order to offer our children better opportunities. Currently I need to stock my business more, but I do not have the capital to serve my clients.

loans.use: Purchase of men’s pants, men’s and women’s underwear, men’s shirts, towels, children’s clothing, hats, etc.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six women of the Les Jumelles association, led by Rokhaya N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The business consists of buying domestic and personal care products such as soap, bleach, deodorant, etc. – cosmetic products and other diverse products that are easy to market depending on the seasons – from wholesale dealers, and reselling them at retail prices in order to make a profit.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Le développement de l’entreprenariat féminin constitue dans la politique de l’état du Sénégal, l’alternative la plus fiable pour ouvrir la voie à un développement de l’initiative privée et à la promotion de la femme. C’est de cette prise de conscience qu’est né l’idée de ce projet qui doit être mise en œuvre dans le village de Yoff, qui concentre aujourd’hui beaucoup d’activités commerciales, mais qui laisse encore de là place au commerce de produit d’entretien domestique, et cosmétique : une façon de promouvoir l’hygiène et la santé des populations, et de mettre en valeur les femmes.

Objectif : Augmenté le revenu des membres du groupement parle profit tiré de la vente des produits et améliorer les conditions du centre de développement communautaire communément appelé ORT Yoff.

Activités : Le projet consiste à acheter en gros des produits d’entretien domestique : savon, eau de javel, déodorant, etc.… des produits cosmétiques et divers produits faciles à écouler sur le marché selon les saisons, et à les revendre aux prix du détail pour en tirer profit»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and has restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of soap, bleach, deodorant, etc.; transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Sarahi

texts.en: My name is Sarahi, I’m a merchant and I sell new clothing for people of all ages. I have been doing this work for several years, and, with the income generated, I can help cover my family’s expenses and other commitments I have to suppliers. My idea is to be able to by a car so that I could travel to other cities to buy merchandise at a better price, and thus have greater earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of men’s and women’s pants, ladies’ blouses, underwear, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Francis Dinorah

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Francis. I have run a business in the center of my community called Variedades Francis (Francis' Variety) for a number of years, selling clothing and accessories. It generates income to help me cover family expenses and also arrange deals from suppliers. Currently my sales volume has been growing and I don't have the sufficient funds to satisfy the demand. I need to expand my inventory so I can offer my clients a wider variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es francis, mi actividad es el comercio, cuento con un negocio en el centro de mi comunidad, llamado Variedades Francis, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastod de mi familia y demas conpromisos con proveedores, actualmente el volumen de venta ha crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente necesito ampliar mis inventarios y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Buy undergarments, towels, sandals, men's shirts, blouses, T-shirts, pants, hats, etc.

loans.name: Marlon Francisco

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Marlon. I have run a small used clothing store that is located in one of the most traveled sections of my city for a number of years. The business generates income to cover family expenses and also make deals with suppliers. Currently I need to increase my inventory since my sales volumen is growing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Marlon, soy comerciante cuento con un pequeño negocio de ropa Usada ubicado en uno de los lugares mas transitados de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: Buy a bundle of adult's shirts and T-shirts, towels, bed sheets and undergarments.

loans.name: Felisa Elizabeth

texts.en:
Felisa Elizabeth is married and a mother of two: a 22 year old son and a 14 year old daughter. They live in Mérida, Yucatán. Her husband is a retailer; he sells electronics, but the income he receives from this activity is not enough to cover the family’s basic needs. This is why three years ago, Felisa decided to start selling watches, so she could help her husband with the family’s expenses and her son and daughter’s education. Now, Felisa needs a loan of $250. She will use this money to purchase more merchandise thus increasing her sales. She believes in the generosity of people who help those in need. She needs your support and is grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Felisa Elizabeth es una mujer casada y madre de un hijo de 22 y una hija de 14 años, ellos viven en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Su esposo es comerciante y vende artículos electrónicos, sin embargo el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia, por lo que Felisa hace tres años decidió iniciar con la venta de relojes, con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos.

Ahora Felisa necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar sus ventas, ella confía en la generosidad de las personas para ayudar a quién más lo necesita, ella necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: surtir mercancía

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.en:
María Eugenia is a responsible enterprising woman who has been making and selling piñatas for the past 20 years. She learned this trade from her father. She is married and in order to help with the family’s expenses, she installed a workshop in her house, starting her own business. The demand for her products is good and is on the rise. She needs to increase her production and for this, she needs a loan of $550 to buy the necessary materials. You can be an important part of the of this business. With your help, Maria will achieve great things! She has worked very hard to maker business succeed and she is thankful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

María Eugenia es una mujer responsable y emprendedora, que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas desde hace 20 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre. Ella es casada y para contribuir al gasto familiar instaló un taller en su propia casa, y así comenzó con este negocio. La demanda por sus productos es buena y va en aumento, razón por la que ella quiere incrementar la elaboración de sus productos, para esto ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 dólares, para conseguir los materiales que necesita.

Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, con tu ayuda María puede hacer grandes cosas, ella ha trabajado mucho para sacar adelante su oficio y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: compra de insumos

loans.name: Reyna Cristina

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Reyna Cristina. I have run a clothing store in the center of my city for a number of years. It generates income to cover family expenses and also arrange deals with suppliers. Summer time is approaching and I need to supply my business with more seasonal products, keeping in mind that the sales volume will also be larger.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre el Reina Cristina, cuento con un negocio de veta de ropa de ambos sexos, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad,tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, aprovechando la temporada de verano necesito surtir mas mi negocio con producto de temporada tomando en cuenta que el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: Buy sandals, swimsuits, shorts, towels, jeans and other seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Ramona. I run a small family hamburger restaurant called Paraiso de la Amburguesas (Hamburger Paradise). Thanks to this business, my husband and I have been able to improve the quality of life for our children. Our product is quite popular in, and because the demand is growing we need more capital to be able to satisfy our clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Ramona, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de hamburguesas llamado Paraiso de la Amburguesas, gracias a este negocio mi esposo y yo emos sacado adelanate a nuestros hijos ya que nuestro producto tiene mucha aceptación en esta ciudad, en vista que la demanda ha crecido necesitamos mayor capital para poder satisfacer a nuestros cliente.

loans.use: Buy ground beef, bread, mayonnaise, mustard, vegetables and various condiments.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel lives in García and has been working as a gardener for the past 6 years. He started as a gardener when he was fired from his previous job, because the company had to cut personnel. Miguel is married and has a two year old daughter. His wife and daughter are his source of strength and perseverance to work and help his family get ahead. His daughter is growing and so are the family's expenses. The tools Miguel uses are not good enough to get him more work, because they are old and slowing him down when doing larger gardening work.

Therefore, Miguel needs a US$475 loan to buy new equipment, which could save him time when doing his job and earn him more income. The art of gardening has helped him maintain his family for all these years and he is convinced that, with the support he will get, he will better provide for his wife and daughter. Miguel is grateful to the loaners for their help and trust they have in him. He will repay the loan within 5 to 10 months.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Miguel vive en la ciudad de García y tiene el oficio de jardinero desde hace ya 6 años, el cual comenzó a ejercer cuando fue despedido del trabajo anterior por ajustes en el personal de la compañía en la que se encontraba en aquel entonces. Miguel es un hombre casado y actualmente tiene una hija de dos años de edad, quienes son la fuente de su empeño y la fuerza para trabajar y sacar adelante a su familia. Su hija esta creciendo y con ello los gastos familiares se incrementan, por lo que Miguel con las herramientas con las que cuenta no son suficientes para poder tener más trabajo por el tiempo que le lleva realizar las labores de jardinería más tardadas con herramientas obsoletas.

Por ello Miguel esta solicitando un crédito por US $ 475 para comprar equipo de trabajo que le ahorre tiempo con sus labores y pueda obtener mejores ingresos, ya que este arte de la jardinería le ha ayudado a poder mantener a su familia por estos años y esta convencido de que con este apoyo el podrá obtener mayores beneficios para su familia. Miguel les agradece a los prestamistas por la ayuda que le brindan y la confianza que tienen en él, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 5 a 10 meses.

loans.use: compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a retired worker and the only income he gets is the pension he receives for the years he worked. This amount is very little because in Mexico, pensions are low. Miguel has always liked to be doing something, so he categorizes himself as an active person. Now that he has no work, Miguel decided to open a grocery store. His wife is the only person that keeps him company, and he would like to offer her a better quality of life, because he believes there are still many more things he can do in life. Miguel and his wife have 8 sons and daughters, they are all married and left home to live with their own families.

Miguel is very happy with what he has accomplished in life, yet he would like to live a better quality of life with his wife. This is why he is requesting a US$475 loan; to buy merchandise for his store and see it grow. Miguel awaits your collaboration and generosity, expecting to return the loan within 6 to 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Miguel es un trabajador retirado, que ahora solo vive de la pensión que recibe por los años de trabajo, siendo esta pensión muy poca, ya que en México las pensiones son muy bajas. Miguel es una persona que durante toda su vida le ha gustado estar haciendo algo, por lo que el se cataloga como una persona muy activa, y ahora sin trabajo, decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes. Él tiene actualmente como única compañía a su esposa y desea darle una mejor calidad de vida ya que aún siente que puede hacer muchas cosas más en la vida. Miguel y su esposa tienen 8 hijos quienes están casados y dejaron su hogar para vivir con sus respectivas familias.

Miguel está muy contento con lo logrado en la vida pero desea tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su esposa, por ello esta solicitando de un préstamo de US$ 475 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Miguel espera su colaboración y generosidad, esperando devolver el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses.

loans.use: compra de mercancia

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
Catarino is married and has 4 children who are currently studying. Catarino has a business selling hardware. His children help him even though they are studying, they help out with the family business. Catarino’s business is located in his house, and his sales have allowed him to help educate his children.

Catarino knows the business well and knows that there are times during the year when demand increases. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to stock up on inventory to supply his business. The amount that Catarino is asking for is $550, which he offers to pay back in 6 to 12 months. He is awaiting the requested support and trusts that the lenders will help him. Because of this, he and his family are very appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Catarino es un hombre casado que tiene 4 hijos, los cuales están actualmente estudiando. Catarino tiene un negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes, en el cual le ayudan sus hijos que a pesar de estar estudiando, colaboran con él en este negocio familiar. El negocio de Catarino esta ubicado en su casa, y con sus ventas ha logrado y mantiene aún ayudándole en la educación de sus hijos.

Catarino conoce bien el negocio y sabe en que épocas del año su demanda se incrementa por lo que actualmente esta solicitando un crédito para abastecerse de mercancía y a la vez surtir los productos de su negocio. El monto que Catarino solicita es de US $ 550 que ofrece pagar en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Espera el apoyo solicitado y confía en que los prestamistas lo van a ayudar por lo que él y su familia están muy agradecidos.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his hardware store

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Julia. I have run a used clothing store for a number of years. It generates revenue to cover family expenses and also arrange deals with suppliers. Thanks to this business I have given my children an education, even though I'm a single mother. My family depends on this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Julia, mi actividas principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de Ropa usada, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para mis gastos familiares y demas conpromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio he dado a mis hijos educacion aun cuando soy madre soltera y que de este negocio depende mi familia.

loans.use: Buy a load of mixed clothing (adults, children, sporting, etc.), sheets, towels, etc.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fany Guadalupe

texts.en:
My name is Fany Guadalupe. I have run a used clothing business in the center of my community for a number of years, so I am very familiar with this line of work. The most important part is that it allows me to tend to my two children and at the same time generate income to help cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

Mi nombre es Fany Guadalupe, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de Ropa Usada, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que conosco muy bien y lo mas importante es que me permite atender a mis 2 hijos y a la vez me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Buy a load of summery clothes, sheets and undergarments.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fanny  Yaniret

texts.en:
My name is Fanny Yaniret. I run a used clothing business located in the center of my community called La Favorita (The Favorite). It generates income to help me cover family expenses and improve our quality of life. Currently demand is increasing, seeing that the cost of new clothes is higher and the majority of people opt to buy used clothes. I need to add more supplies to my business so I can offer a wider variety and better prices to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

Mi nombre es Fanny Yaniret, soy comerciante cuento con negocio de venta de ropa usada, llamado La Favorita, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de esa forma mejorar nuestro nivel de vida. actualmente la demanda a crecido en vista que el costo de la ropa nueva es mayor la mayoria de las personas optan por comprar ropa usada, actualmente necesito sutir mas mi negocio y asi ofrecer mayor varedad y mejores precios a mis cliente.

loans.use: Buy a load of mixed clothing (pants, children's clothes, etc.)

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Takku association, led by Fatou S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Context: The Magal of Touba [an annual pilgrimage to the Muslim holy city of Touba, near the village of Ker Gu Mag] is always an opportunity to strengthen very profitable small-scale trading activities, both during and after the Magal of Touba. The women’s groups that are organized in the village lack access to the financial resources they need to diversify their business activities in order to take better advantage of the floods of pilgrims who pass through.

General purpose: To increase the income of our members through profits made from small-scale trade, and to make our business activities permanent.

Business activities: Bulk purchase and retail sale of small consumer articles and foodstuffs. The business will consist of developing small-scale trade of small consumer articles and foodstuffs purchased in Dakar [the capital and largest city of Senegal], taking advantage of the presence in Dakar of Chinese traders, who offer a good deal both in terms of price and diversity of merchandise. Our strategy is to purchase a great variety of inexpensive consumer articles.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte du projet : Le magal de TOUBA est toujours une opportunité de renforcer les activités du petit commerce très rentables pendant et après le magal de TOUBA. Les groupements de femmes organisées autour de l’écovillage chaque année souffrent du manque de ressources financières pour diversifier les activités pour mieux profité du flux des pèlerins de passage.

Objectif général : Augmenter les revenus des membres par le profit tiré du petit commerce et pérenniser les activités des femmes

ACTIVITES : Commerce de petits articles et denrées de consommations. Il s’agira d e développer des activités de petits commerces ( petits articles de consommation) achetés à DAKAR avec la présence du marché chinois qui offre de bonnes dispositions autant sur le plan du prix des articles que sur le plan de leur diversité. La stratégie de mise en œuvre passera par l’achat d’articles commodes très diversifiés et peux coûteux »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of small consumer goods and foodstuffs; transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five members of the Ngaye Cordonnerie association, led by Moustapha T.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“ Context : The business is located in the village of Meckhe, which is famous for its locally crafted shoes, made from cow, sheep and goat leather. The village of Meckhe is also the only village of Senegal where these types of shoes are found.

Objective: To support local artisans, to enable demand for their products to be met robustly, and to create revenue for the villagers, especially the members of our group.

Business activities: Production and marketing of shoes; creation of employment.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte : Le projet se situ dans l’éco village de Méckhé ; village réputé en coordonnerie local avec des peau de : Vache, mouton, et chèvre. Le village de Méckhé est en outre le seul village du Sénégal ou on trouve des chaussures de ce genre.

Objectif : Appuyer les artisans locaux Assurer la forte réponse à la demande Créer des revenus monétaires pour les populations et en particulier les bénéficiaires.

Activités :

Fabrication de chaussures

Fournir le marché

Créer de l’emploi »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and equipment for traditional shoemaking business
